Walls are yellow, carpet is green. The room is kind of decent, but you just get a creepy feeling staying there. Beware, the bed sags, and the hallway is really cold. Also, there is some creepy guys walking around.

The hotel had good reviews and basically we agree.  The staff was very polite and helpful.  The hotel and rooms were clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was fine.  The only downside for us was the lack of a refrigerator and microwave in the room.  The access to the highway was fine.

Summary Heading: Good to be back in Seal Beach
Summary: Close to beach walking, or antique shoppe strolling this Hotel Staff Considerate and Friendly. The rooms are spacious and Quiet too!!!  Try the Main Street restaurants plus a little coffee roaster and a fine Italian Restaurant. Three great breakfast places too... Cheers Walter

Summary Heading: Decent Hampton Inn - Rooms could be better maintained
Summary: This was a decent Hampton Inn. The room was a little "shop worn" and not as well maintained as I'm accustomed to at a typical HI, but I had a pleasant night's stay. I like the condition of the rooms at the HI - Cypress better, newer rooms and better maintained. Next time I'm in the area, I'll stay at the Cypress location which is not too far from this location.

Although it is not next to much, it's close to Long Beach and less than q half hour to Disney. Room and service was the best and the room was perfect. Great value for singles and families! I highly recommend!

It was very accommodating for our family of 6.   Great breakfast, clean rooms and cookies and hot chocolate for the kids in the afternoon.  The staff was very resourceful and helpful considering they were at maximum capacity and mostly full of crazy hockey kids, but they handled it well!

My son and I came for orientation to California State University Long Beach and it was a just a few miles away. We would definitely stay again. The beds were comfortable and the breakfast food was very good.

The hotel staff was very pleasant.  The facilities were clean and modern.  Breakfast was set up early and breakfast to go bags were available.  There were convenient restaurants within walking distance for lunch and dinner.  The room was very nice; however, I would have preferred a room with a military discount which was not available.

Summary Heading: Beat the prices of Long Beach Ca.
Summary: The hotel is a 2-3 mi. drive to Pac. Cst. Hiway. and Seal Beach.  The hotel is an average Hampton. A couple of little factors in the Suite room make it so. The shower head is 7.5 feet up the wall. Can't adjust! "Corn" colored walls. Our room was last room down hall, 2nd floor right out of elevator long walk. Breakfast was good. Attendant needs to stop talking in Mexican to her fellow emp. constantly and loudly such as all guests can hear while eating. Pillows in TV  lounge on arrival were all crunched down in their chairs. Looked unkempt. Dark curtains in room were excellent. Four port electrical outlet on bed tableside did not work. "Comfy" bed. Subway and Dennys and a Japanese and Taco Bell right outside. Drive for 2 miles for any restaurants.

A very friendly staff. Hotel rooms very clean. Great breakfast, Close to many places to eat. Close to downtown Seal beach where we had a great time!! Lots of nice resturants down town. Very relaxing hotel, We would definitely stay at this location again,

Summary Heading: Staff is outstanding and very professional
Summary: Stayed many times at this property and am always pleased with the friendly service, spotless rooms, good breakfast, and overall attention to detail.  Members of my family and other relatives have also stayed at this Seal Beach property and all agree that it is first rate.

Summary Heading: Great for a Staycation - Whirlpool Tub FTW
Summary: I don't tend to be snobby about a hotel room when traveling because I would rather be out exploring, but when it came time to plan my boyfriend's birthday weekend I decided a staycation at a hotel with known spa tubs was the way to go. Hampton Inn & Suites did not disappoint. I booked the King Whirlpool room directly through their website (and got a AAA discount) and was able to check in early for room 405 when it got closer to the date.  The hotel itself is not overly fancy, but nice enough that you feel like staying there is sort of an event. The room was huge, had a microwave and a small refrigerator, and the triangle whirlpool tub included a flat screen TV above it, which made for a surreal experience of soaking and watching TV in the bathroom. There was also a double-head

Our group originally was to stay at the Pacific Inn, but there was a misunderstanding and could not get the whole group booked there, so the Hampton Inn had enough accommodations for us all.  The location was not as ideal, but the price was less and the quality of the rooms and hospitality was more than adequate.

Summary Heading: Seal Beach, CA Hampton Inn & Suites
Summary: Great location, impressively clean, reasonably priced with friendly, helpful staff.  The beds at the Hampton Inn are like no other hotel.  I always get a great, restful sleep.  Would definitely return and recommend to anyone.

Very nice hotel and staff. Not far from Seal beach and other beaches. Short drive to LA and John Wayne airport. The only issues were pool and front drive were closed for remodeling. Starbucks in parking lot

Access & parking very poor.  Only Hampton Inn that we have ever stayed in without a refrigerator or microwave.  Also, very poor service in that motel.  Would not recommend this place to anyone.  All other Hampton Inns have been excellent.

Summary Heading: Can't Beat it for the Price
Summary: We visit  family in Seal Beach (the hometown of my childhood) a few times a year. We are on a tight budget and can't really afford the spendier properties in the area, but find that if we don't spend at least $100+, we get pretty sketchy options.  For $127/night, staying in a Hampton Inn is a pretty nice prospect. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the location right near the beach can't be beat, and they offer a fairly sizeable breakfast. We really like this property and stay there as often as we can.  The bummer:  When we stayed this time, the pool was out of commission and the parking lot was being paved. When I expressed my dismay at check-in, the concierge said, "we DO have an ocean..." I thought it was kind of snotty. As it turned out, the weather was really overcast and

This Hampton Inn is a great place to stay when visiting the Seal Beach area for business or for pleasure.  The staff, the rooms, the workout room, and the complimentary breakfast are sure to please the average traveler.  Just note that the sound from the traffic on Seal Beach Blvd can be a bit noticeable in the morning and evening commute times.

Stayed at this Hampton Inn for two nights while on business in SoCal.    Location is outstanding, 30 mins from LAX, 1 mile off the 405, minutes to Disney Anaheim and Huntington Beach.  Also just a stones throw from Seal Beach Naval Weapons Center, Los Alamitos Training Center and all the defense contractors in Long Beach.  Lots of food options nearby, including a Starbucks and DelTaco just across the parking lot.  This Hampton seemed to be very new.  Room was outstanding, very fresh and new.  Staff was very friendly and provided recommendations and directions for dinner options.  Morning complementary breakfast had scrambled eggs, potatoes, cereal, pastries and fresh fruit.  All in all, a nice stay and exactly what you would expect from a Hampton Inn....the location here is the

Travelled with family for graduation. Very satisfied and very clean. It must be given 5 star rating. My family enjoyed the stay as well. Breakfast was very nice and had variety of items. The room was very clean too.

Summary Heading: Busness or Pleasure Always the Best Place To Stay
Summary: Always clean, respectable landscape, friendly people in all departments. Very family organized. Easy parking, to load and unload cargo, suitcases, and people. Pool area clean and kept up. Rooms clean and fresh, everything you need to be right at home.

First I would have given 5 stars, but the breakfast was just fair. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms spacious and very clean. The hotel is located in a quite neighborhood, but has all the neccesities within walking distance. Food right outside the room; Subway, Starbucks, Japanese, Del Taco, within a block Dominos and Denny's. Dollar Tree around the corner, 5 banks around the corner, 2 gas stations. Great location. My only issue was the TV remote didn't work and after 3 tries got one that barely worked, didn't watch much TV anyway. One thing to note the night staff is reduced to one person and you have to go to the front desk for assistance. Even though only 4 stars I will definitely stay there again.

Excellent location, convienant to local dining, gas stations, banks, and shopping. Denny's, Del Taco, Subway, Japanese, Starbucks, Dollar Tree within walking distance.  Price was fair, rooms very clean and spacious. Staff very friendly. Very quite neighborhood at night. Will definitely stay here again.

Except for being close to the Pacific Shore, this is a standard Hampton Suites. Looks and operates like every one else off the assembly line. I've stayed here several times since it is right across the parking lot to the Boeing Customer Support facility. It's also across the street from the US Navy's Seal Beach Naval Weapons Station. Two miles to Seal Beach's Main St. and the fishing pier. No restaurant in the property, and very limited food in walking distance (a Taco drive up, a Denny's, a Japanese cuisine lunch place, and a Starbucks). There are quite a few restaurants and bars on Main St.  Limited amenities in the hotel lobby. A tiny snack store, free coffee, passable breakfast selection. Not a great deal in the rooms either. Decent TV and WiFi. No room safes or

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn, Seal Beach, CA stay for visit to family living in Leisure World
Summary: Excellent hotel, very convenient to Leisure World.  First-rate service and amenities.  I've stayed there for three years in a row, and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.  Quiet and comfortable.  Excellent breakfast room and wide variety of foods.  Gets the day off to a good start!

THis hotel is clean and offered a comfortable place for me and my family to stay during our vacation. It is close to the pier and local shops which is a lovely town. Please stop by the Taco Surf on main st. and get the Baja tacos, they are excellent. Also brunch at crema café is enjoyable as well. The pool is small but adequate and my kids had fun. The locals are nice, a lot nicer than the folks you meet in LA!

Very clean, but did not have mine fridge or microwave/ Otherwise pure Hilton. Fine breakfast. Good location for Seal Beach or Sunset Beach. Not much furnature for couple or family visit, Somewhat expensive for location and previous visits.

The hotel was clean, staff were accommodating, continental breakfast very good and nice daily variety, room was clean, bathrooms were clean.  No noise. No complaints at all.  Would recommend this hotel.

we had to book at the last minute for a soccer tournament. The rooms were still available and the price was right. Very satisfied with the rooms and cleanliness of the rooms and beds. Do not change what the company is doing. It's great and it works.

This is a very nice hotel. Very clean. The staff wonderful. Beds VERY comfortable with lily white duvets, really clean looking. Breakfast offered everything from cooked bacon and eggs to fresh waffles u cook yourself. Very nice breakfast room. Will for sure return.

I spent two separate nights at the Hampton Inn and enjoyed both nights. The hotel is located within a few minutes of the 405, and a few minutes of "downtown" Seal Beach and the ocean, as well as being close to Long Beach. Despite all of this, you'll need a car because there aren't many places to eat nearby...but parking is plentiful.   Check in is quick and the staff friendly. The rooms are typical Hampton Inn - clean, comfy bed, large TV, desk/chair, and fast free WiFi. That being said, I was surprised that on these two different stays, even with the same room category on the same floor, they were laid out very differently. Not a negative thing, just an observation.  Breakfast is typical Hampton Inn - basic and not the greatest, but it's included.   Would certainly stay again

My husband and I stayed here one night for a fun weekend away, and on a whim decided to pay the less than $20 upgrade (with AAA discount) for the Jacuzzi suite.  And oh my goodness, we were SO happy with the room!  It had a beautiful triangle shaped jacuzzi tub large enough for two adults and a shower the TWO shower heads- one of them attached to the ceiling!  It was about the same experience as we had going to the Madonna Inn a few weekends before, but for hundreds of dollars less!   Aside from the bathroom, the room itself was nice, with a very comfortable king sized bed with extra plugs on one night stand. The room also had a little kitchen set up with a microwave, mini-fridge and sink as you come in the door.  There was also a little couch and a pretty desk.  It if had had

In the last couple years, it's become increasingly difficult to find a room here within per diem. Other hotels in the area seem to gouge less. This place needs to remember their local roots and support the hands that feed them.

The room was large and very clean and staff were very helpful. There are places to east right next to the restaurant which is helpful. This Hotel in not very close to the beach but ideal for a business stop.

It was not top of the line accommodations but not bad either. It was somewhere in the middle on the above average side. I would probably stay there again just because it was close to where I was working.

We stayed here for two nights while we were visiting friends in the area. We feel we know what to expect from Hampton Inn hotels and we were not disappointed. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable, the breakfast is very good.

Summary Heading: Comfy beds, clean rooms, friendly staff
Summary: I stayed in 4 different rooms over 4 weeks at this hotel, the beds are amazing and super comfortable. The breakfast area was also very good and had several options that it did not feel like I was stuck in a routine over those weeks. The front desk staff were awesome and super friendly, so too were the cleaning staff and the kitchen staff. Rooms were cleaned everyday, unless you don't want to have it cleaned. The bathroom was very nice as well and the towels were very clean. Definitely look forward to visiting this hotel again. This hotel is also very close to a Subway, Del Taco, Dominos pizza place and a Starbucks.

Summary Heading: Quiet and Restful Stay for Business Trip
Summary: I was very pleased with the accommodations at Hampton Inn Seal Beach for a recent business trip. The room was clean and comfortable. The stay was restful after a busy day, and quiet. Breakfast was pretty standard fare, fresh and abundant. Staff was helpful and very friendly. I would stay here again.

Beautiful hotel, great service even if breakfast is an instant type full breakfast. It was also a great location, Close to seal beach, and in between long beach and Orange County where I do work in both location. Oh, and there is a Starbucks, nail salon, subway, and Japanese food, and other quick food near buy if you need a quick bite, coffee, or manacure.

We enjoyed our short stay there very much.  Everything was just right. We didn't use much of the amenities so we can't comment, but in general we were very happy. Will most likely go there again should we need a place in the future.

Stayed here for the third time in the past 5 months. Clean rooms,good cleaning service, typical buffet breakfast , friendly front desk and quite rooms. Internet worked better than most. Could use a few more parking spaces, but a minor detail. Decent rates.

Summary Heading: Awesome Hampton Inn Near the Beach!
Summary: Stayed here twice in 2 weeks while on business in the region - a great choice away from the hustle & bustle of Long Beach and the freeways.  The rooms are very large by Hampton standards and quite comfortable. Very friendly and helpful staff, great breakfast as usual. It's less than 5 minutes' drive to wonderful Seal Beach, the pier and all the local cafes and shops, and 10-15 to Long Beach.  If you are flying in/out of LGB Long Beach airport it's also a great choice, and overall very good mid-point between L.A. and the O.C.   Bonus: Starbucks right across the parking lot! Rooms near the center of the hotel are quietest, facing the small shopping center - traffic noise can be loud but does quiet down overnight.

This hotel was nice and clean, beds seemed like they had recently been updated.  Room layout was spacious.  The breakfast was good, plenty of options to get your fill.  Gym was nice.  My only complaint was the tub/shower was slightly moldy around the surround.

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn continues to knock it out of the park
Summary: I travel almost every week and stay in all types of hotels. Hampton Inn continues to have a high, consistent quality in it's hotels no matter where the location. I used to use Marriott properties but they don't have the same value that I find in Hilton/Hampton properties.

Very clean room (stayed in room 325) and grounds. Far enough from the Long beach Airport yet close enough to get anywhere in Signal Hill rather quickly. The room itself was basic IE. Coffee maker, Iron, desk and two queen beds. The reason for 4 instead of 5 stars was because of the bed and breakfast. They put a bed skirt on that is very slippery so while you laid in bed it would move during the night. The comforter was very hot but with only a sheet underneath it was hard to maintain a comfortable sleeping temperature. lastly, Please stop killing the bacon with the microwave. It just does not taste good.  Here are the good features and where there are opportunities to improve.  Good Features:  Work out center,  Pool and Spa. Clean and Quite. Easy in and out parking area. Food

Summary Heading: Convenient Location, Excellent Customer Service and Minutes to the Beach
Summary: A run-of-the-mill Hampton Inn but at least they do have suites. Very close to the Belmont Shore neighborhood of Long Beach and a short drive to the beach.  Excellent rooms and a decent hot breakfast every morning.  Free Wi-Fi in the rooms and public areas.

The hotel is very nice, I have stayed here several time, the rooms are large and clean.  Staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The hotel is close to the beaches, Seal Beach offers a nice choice of restaurants and shops that is close to the hotel.  Breakfast hot food (eggs/meat) was a little disappointing but breakfast offered a large selection of other choices.

Summary Heading: Hampton-no more, no less.  But no fridge in the room
Summary: I stayed here on business for two nights and was satisfied.  The hotel is clean, the staff friendly and helpful.  There;s not much immediately nearby; you have to get in the car or be willing to walk 45 minutes to find a good restaurant. The fitness room is small, has an elliptical, recumbent bike, two treadmills and some weights.  it does not open until 6:00 am, which is a problem for east coast business visitors who wake up at 4 or  5am and need to get going by 6:30 or 7.   Breakfast was the same as any other Hampton. The room did not have a refrigerator, which was unusual.

Good service, typical Hampton inn, near beach, restaurants.   Outdoor pool, almost heated.  Seal beach is a delightful beach community, ocean pier, white sand. Very windy at times.  Nice restaurants, cafes, lots of selection  Stay here when I'm in so California

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for relax!
Summary: The hotel location is very good, close to a plaza and beach. I went on a business trip. Because of the traffic out of the window, sometime it got a bit noisy, but not too bad. The room is big and clean. I would stay in the same place next time when I go there with my family!

This hotel was in a great location with a close proximity to Seal Beach and Huntington Beach.  Access to major roads and freeways was a breeze.  The rooms were clean and well kept.  The common areas were also well kept and clean.  The property is well suited for business travelers.  The breakfast is adequate and convenient.  There were different hot items every day and fresh fruit.  I used the fitness center on a few occasions and it was also adequate.  The equipment was kept clean and in service as well as always stocked with towels and water.  The staff was very friendly and nice.  I had some frozen food that I needed to keep frozen and the staff was gracious enough to keep it in a freezer downstairs.  Also, the Japanese eatery across the parking lot has very good food.  I

Always a very nice stay at this hotel. Front desk employees and manager are always helpful, friendly and looking out to make sure stay is pleasant. The total hotel staff from managers to room attendants are always very nice!

Hotel is centrally located to Long Beach, Seal Beach, Huntington Beach.  It is also close to freeway access.  It is clean, offers a good breakfast and nice eating area.  The staff were helpful and friendly.

I've stayed here several times before as the location is FANTASTIC. Quiet, spacious and clean rooms. This is what you would expect for a typical Hampton Inn. What you may not expect is the incredible level of customer service the front desk staff offer. I did not catch the name of the young man who helped me and my party upon our arrival, but he was courteous, helpful and kind. These are the important touches that will keep me coming back each time I'm in this area. I highly recommend business travelers take my advice and stay here.

If your're looking for a hotel located close to the Beach City's in Orange County (So Cal), look no further; always have enjoyed our stays here and have come back repeatedly due to the location and always welcoming and accommodating staff!

Summary Heading: This is THE place to stay if you are visiting Seal Beach/Long Beach/Orange County
Summary: We have been staying at this Hampton Inn almost every year since it opened several years ago. We are always amazed at the superb customer service, welcoming staff, great breakfast, and comfortable rooms and lobby. Kudos to the breakfast attendants who keep the delicious offerings well stocked and the dining area immaculate. We would not stay anywhere else on our annual vacation visits. The location is perfect-Seal Beach is charming and the hotel is conveniently located near the freeway for easy access to other Southern California attractions. On our last visit, Cindy B at the reception desk went out of her way to help make certain that the logistics for our last stay was problem free. Many of the other area hotels are out of date -this Hampton Inn still looks and feels brand new

Summary Heading: New Years Visit fo Long Beach area
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during a visit with our son.  The rooms are nice rooms, clean, with toiletries and coffee.  The staff were friendly.  A breakfast was provided which made it nice to grab something to eat before heading out for the day.  A little bit of traffic noise in our room but not excessive.

We stayed here for 3 nights while in town for a memorial service.  The staff was friendly, the breakfast options were fantastic and the hotel was clean and nicely decorated. It was conveniently located and we will definitely be back again!

Wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy all the amenities!  Although our stay was short, we were extremely impressed on every level!  There was great attention to detail.  Every employee encounter was friendly and helpful.

We stayed Dec 24-26 2015. The staff is very helpful, Coffee available 24/7 is fresh option for tea is nice.  The complementary breakfast is standard fare.  The dining area is nicely un-crowded Wifi is very slow Our room was 428 and it was very nice. King bed Nice and comfortable. One should note that the afternoon sun shnes right into the large window. Other wise the room was great.

Summary Heading: Great clean choice for the price.
Summary: Love this place as a value play and as a clean consistent choice. I stay in O. C. many time a year and let me tell you most of the hotels 2,3,4 star choices are gross. look at trip advisor most places are dated, filthy , old and have serious issues and most are more than this price. Folks look at all the tripadvisor reviews!  This place is no 5 star but it is great choice , clean and good . I often stay 3-5 days at a time and no issue.   Breakfast is not high quality but good and convenient so you don't have to drop $25 on food and wait in crowns in CA.   So overall a great deal . Also this place is better than Cypress location but is often $35-50 more per night . Less Disney going families at seal beach location. Will stay again next week and update you if it changes .

Summary Heading: A Pleasant Place to Stay in Seal Beach
Summary: We traveled to Seal Beach for a family reunion and stayed two nights at the Hampton Inn.  The hotel staff was extremely friendly and attentive to our needs.  They were very helpful with restaurant recommendations and other things to do.  The rooms are large and very well kept.  We found the mattress to be quite firm but overall slept well. Breakfast is offered from 7 a.m. to 10 a.m. for free, and there is a Starbucks very nearby.  Traveling from the Hampton Inn to the downtown pier area of Seal Beach was a 10 minute or less trip, very convenient.  It was also a convenient location for visiting our family member in Leisure World.

I was there for work but this hotel is great that staff always want to help. Room was great as I was upgraded to a suit. Also its close to the downtown area which has plenty of shops and places to eat.

Cannot think of any negative comments.  Everything was very good to excellent, the room, the staff, the breakfast.  Easy access, to the property, local restaurants, shopping, and activities.  Only problem was freeway traffic from I 10.  California problem beyond Hampton,s control.

Very pleasant hotel.  Great staff, clean room, adequate breakfast.  Good location, good Wi-Fi.  Fitness Room a bit small, but adequate.  During the night, there was a lot of noise at the room next door.  Called the lobby and they took care if it.

For a businessman who travel most of the year it is not pleasant to be in hotel where none care about you. None ask you anything. Barely they greet you. We, the frequent travelers, need a cosy place where to feel welcomed like if we were at home...a second home..
Manager Response: We apologize for your experience, and thank you for bringing this to our attention.  We hope you give us another opportunity and really show you the kind of service we pride ourselves with.  Rest assured, we will address this with the team.

Summary: $200 plus tax, no airport shuttle, or info on how to get one, poor food no Salsa, potatoes soggy, poor coffee esp in room ( no creamers) ..crummy coffee maker and coffee..disinterested staff, slow internet ..managers instead of trying  to fix problems and bring them up to normal Hampton standards are very defensive and try defend their actions when fixing the problems would be easier and more productive.

The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our rooms were very clean. The pool was very cold for the month of November but the hot tub worked very well. The hotel was close to fast food and quick shopping, but the shops on Main Street in Seal Beach are amazing. The variety of places to each was awesome.

It is difficult to say much about this hotel -it is average and not up to the usual Hampton Inn standards-breakfast is bland, coffee is not very good but the in room coffee is worse. Staff seem disinterested.  No ground transport and staff has no info in taxi or shuttle services.All for over $200/night

I stayed at this location for business travel for a week.  It would have been nice to have a refrigerator in the room and the option to order room service. This location does not offer food service onsite except the complimentary breakfast.  Also to be located in Seal Beach, CA it would have been nice for this hotel to provide shuttle service to the beach and local attractions.  I travel often to the West coast from the East coast and do not always opt to rent a car.  It would be nice to have the shuttle as an option to get around especially since there are very limited food options.

rooms clean, front desk helpful. pool access only by going outside the hotel. beds needed to be upgraded, very soft.   close to beach, restaurants, shopping. limited parking during day, more when businesses close up.

We booked through a booking site and the site said our room would have a refrigerator.  We checked in, went to our room whichw as very nice but had no refrigerator.  Went to desk, made a request and were told that the booking site information was incorrect and no refrigerator came with that type room.  As they had no extra refrigerator, the manager was very gracious and upgraded us to another room which did have a refrigerator.  The room also was very nice and even had more amenities.  I suppose the manager communicated to our booking site that their information needed to be corrected.

Summary Heading: First Trip to this property - industrial / undeveloped area surrounding hotel
Summary: Adjacent to the hotel is a Subway, Starbucks, and a taco fast food restaurant.  We did have a car so the 2 - 3 miles to numerous eating establishments and the lively Belmont entertainment district wasn't a hassle at all.  There was also an entrance to the 405 Southbound accessible about 3 miles away through a major street dissecting a residential area so this is a convenient location for navigating through the area.  The area surrounding the hotel is otherwise an industrial area and we felt safe in / around the property.  We had the complimentary breakfast both mornings and there was plenty of selection and the staff kept it fresh.  Scrambled eggs, breakfast sausages, oatmeal, and a waffle iron were the hot choices.  Cold cereals/granola, pastries, fruits, juices, and yogurt

Overall ok stay given it was my third choice of options.  Didn't seem to be any "premium" internet.  Be careful of water temperature drastically changing to scalding temps.  Cleaning could have been a little better in out of site areas (I found food wrappers).  Parking is very limited if arriving late a night.  Pool area seemed nice.  Breakfast always good at Hampton.  Sound proofing seemed good (at least on 4th Floor).

Good location near downtown Seal a Beach without all of the traffic.  Several fast food choices in the parking lot including a Starbucks.  Breakfast was good with several choices in the buffet including waffles.  Room was good size but no refrigerator which you would have expected for a hotel called suites

The Hampton Inn and Suites in Seal Beach was a nice weewkend get away. It's a few blocks away from the quiet little neighborhood  of Seal Beach. The rooms were clean. The staff were friendly. The pool area was nice. Although I think it should be a non-smoking area. If you plan on spending much tome in the room, get the suite with the large jacuzzi tub. There's even a TV by the tub. I'll go back again.

excellent hotel located close to long beach; perfect for business travelers; quiet rooms, close to many nice restaurants; accommodating staff. easy freeway access; post office branch nearby; extremely clean; beautiful.

Summary Heading: Great room and service.  OUT of some breakfast items early
Summary: Hampton Inn at Seal Beach was a typical Hampton Inn with courteous front desk service, clean and quiet rooms, and free wifi.  My husband and I are long-time Hilton Honors members and, when traveling, Hampton Inn is our go-to hotel.  Our only COMPLAINT with this hotel is the breakfast service.  During our stay, some breakfast items were not refilled and they run out of certain food items rather early in the morning.  I recall they were out of bagels and sliced toast bread by 7:45 am on Saturday morning and did not have more to replenish.  Breakfast hours are until 10 am.  That was the first morning.  During the second morning, they were out of cut fruit early.  And, on both mornings, oatmeal toppings (nuts and raisins) containers were empty.

The location is very convenient to Long Beach and western Orange County with easy access to Seal Beach and Long Beach's Alamitos Bay. Location has close access to the freeway and major streets and I'd recommend it if your business/pleasure involves the ocean (a short drive; really too far to walk) and eastern Long Beach and western Orange County. Very little traffic in the area - yes hard to believe for southern California - and close to a Starbucks and a little further to good dining options at Marina Pacifica.  The only negative for this trip was the noise factor from Westminster Blvd.. We were there for three nights and each night we were awakened by 'street races' on the nearby Westminster Blvd. as the north and west end of the hotel is just feet from the street.

this hotel is decent. the location is close enough for a nice walk to the beach.   the rooms were clean. i didn't know about the free breakfast until check in. the lobby was nice. this hotel is a very short drive from the freeway.

Summary Heading: They Were Welcoming and Glad to See Me
Summary: Since I’d stay at this property when I’d come out the area for business, it only made sense to stay here when I was coming here for vacation.  Being centrally located to the attractions I wanted to see was one of the major factors, and another was the quality of the breakfast items.  Because I was travelling with people on this trip, it made sense for us to get a single room, one which had two queen beds.  The room was on the third floor (which I liked), and on the front side of the building (so it was warmer when we’d return in the afternoon).  The room was clean and neat, just like any of the times I’d come on business.  This hotel has an outdoor hot tub and a heated pool, which can only be accessed via room card, a business center with computer and printer, and laundry

Summary Heading: Great hotel close to Seal Beach beach and shopping
Summary: This franchise hotel in the Hilton chain is one of the better.Clean and well maintained.the staff is very welcoming and the rooms very comfortable.The free breakfast is very good,you pick what you want and the waffles are very good

Summary Heading: Room smelled like sewer. RUDE manager
Summary: Our room smelled like a sewer. The manager on shift the day we checked out was very rude and condescending. Knowing I could get another room if I were to come back is helpful but because of the treatment we received from her? I won't come back. I wonder if she forgot about social media and all the review sites.

Drove past the hotel because it is set back off the street, but once we found it we realized how close it was to Seal Beach Main Street -- too far to walk, but only a 10 minute drive. We had with spa, which was excellent; the bed and linens were very comfortable, so had a good rest. Bonus points for being next door to Starbucks!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write your review.  We are very happy to know you had a great visit with us.

Summary: We decided to stay here because we had Hilton honors rewards, but I will not be coming back. The internet sucks and we could not log in for more than 5 min before it booted you off. We have a baby that goes to bed early so we like to watch Netflix on the iPad, but that couldn't happen bc we couldn't connect to the internet. It was a long two days.   The hotel is surrounded by busy streets that are constantly buzzing with traffic all night long.   Needless to say, don't stay here if you don't need to or if you are looking for a get away.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I'm sorry to hear about your experience.  We do offer a high-speed internet for $4.95 a day, better suited for streaming.  We appreciate your feedback and take them into consideration as we continually strive to improve.

Summary Heading: Nice room and a pretty good location for the price
Summary: The room was spacious, clean and had comfy beds. The breakfast was good and the staff was friendly. The parking wasn't the greatest but it was free, just not a lot of spots available by the doors. They did have luggage carts and that helped. Short drive form here to the beach, about 10 min.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: I chose this hotel purely because of my past experience with the property, the excellent staff, and their personal touch and professionalism. When I checked for my 2-week stay trying to relocate back to CA from AZ, I wanted to stay in the same room for the whole time. I am very particular about my room, and Jason, the night manager, kindly showed me three to pick from. Cindy, the day manager, was outstanding in linking my many reservations (I had three) together without any problems. When some incredibly disruptive Marines visited and disturbed entire floors of quests, myself included, she comped 2 days (I got no sleep), without missing a beat. That meant the world to me. Medina was always helpful with all of my many requests, be it quieting down rowdy quests or just being a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We are very happy to hear of your great experience during your stay with us.  Thank you for your kind words about the team!  Nothing makes me happier than to be able to share this with all of them.

Summary Heading: Great location easy parking and friendly employees
Summary: Jason and Michael where a real pleasure to work with very professional friendly and helpful. I am very very high maintenance guest and they made me feel very important and take care of all my high maintenance needs and requests you will not be disappointed this is a great location for the picking Customer is looking for a great room at a better price.  Damon 949)633-0190 txt
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, and your kind words.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  We hope to see you back again!

Summary: This hotel location is at an intersection of two major highways,  rooms have views of Del Taco.  It is noisy and totally overpriced!  The front desk staff are not properly trained to accommodate discerning guests.  the only good thing I have to say about this place is the quality of the housekeeping.  I do not plan to ever stay at another Hampton Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We apologize for the issues you had during your stay.  We appreciate your feedback, and we will look into it and continually work to improve.  We hope you consider staying with us again, and we want to provide you the kind of service we pride ourselves with.

Summary: Got in just before midnight. I had called ahead for a roll-a-way bed. Got to the room and everything was perfect. While we didn't use it, we were even able to get a late check out (1pm). Would defiantly stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I'm happy to hear we were able to accommodate your requests.  We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times on our trips to the beach.  Just a mile from the beach, it's the perfect location.  You can walk to Starbuck's and the staff is very friendly.  The lobby has been re-modeled and it looks great.  Breakfast is ok, but it's free, so what can you expect.  Better than spending $30 at McDonald's for a family.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Good to hear you like our newly renovated lobby!  We look forward to having you back with us soon!

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times and the staff and facility is excellent.  Close to Huntington Beach and Seal Beach.  The staff is more than willing to help with anything that is needed.  The breakfast has a great variety of fruit, yogurt, waffles, pastries, eggs and numerous types of bread.  They are plenty of restaurants around the hotel.  I did not use the pool this stay but have in the past.  The pool is clean and very inviting.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and your patronage.  We hope to be your hotel of choice for years to come!

Summary: the in-house amenities are good for families, business travelers, or singles visiting the area.  The location is centrally located with easy freeway access, close to beaches and tourist areas, downtown Los Angeles, and shopping.  The staff is helpful, courteous, and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  It's wonderful to know you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to having you back with us again.

Summary: I have used this location every year for the past 9 years as I travel to see family in Long Beach and Seal Beach.  This is a perfect spot for both.  This hotel offers a clean, friendly, accessible environment.  The staff is helpful and accomodating.  Quickly accessible to Seal Beach's Main Street and Long Beach's Belmont Shore which are great places to shop, walk, and dine.  Good hotel value.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review, and thank you for your patronage over the years!

Summary Heading: Can't Go Wrong with a Hampton
Summary: You can't go wrong with the Hampton Inns and this location was no different.  Close to the Long Beach downtown area and beach that we were visiting.  Always clean, friendly, quiet.  There is not a restaurant on site, but there are quite a few within about a five minutes drive.

We were attending a wedding nearby and needed to find a place to stay for just one night.  We booked a basic room that had comfortable bed, desk and bathroom. Everything was clean and cozy, just exactly what we expected.

This hotel by far is as good as any Hilton Hotel proper. I've stayed in many Hilton hotels over the last 26 years and this Hampton Inn rates with the best of them!  The breakfast is superb, the parking is very is good and the area in which the hotel is in is central to almost any point of interest in the SoCal area.

Summary Heading: Really close to Seal Beach Pier and PCH
Summary: As corporate experiences go, this was a fine place to stay at $179. When a room is clean and everything else makes you happy, (isn't that how it is supposed to be?) then the trip and your companion are the focus.  Nothing but good things to say.

What I like about Hampton Inn's across the country is you know when you book the room it will always be a great experience. I know that my room will be clean and most importantly the bed is always clean and comfy.

Summary Heading: Exactly What You Need It To Be
Summary: Hampton Inn is always a solid choice because you know exactly what you're going to get, and this location served us well. It was convenient to Long Beach, where the event we were in town for was being held, as well as offering easy access to freeways where we could get to other areas, especially in Orange County. Don't be fooled by the "beach" moniker, as you'll have no view of any beach from the hotel. You're next to a Boeing facility and a Navy munitions facility, so not much in the way of sights. But good things including beaches, are a very short drive away. Some minimal road noise at times, but I couldn't say that one side or the other would be better for avoiding that.

Summary Heading: Consistently good option in Seal Beach
Summary: We have always had a good experience when staying here.  The hotel is clean and well-kept, and still looks new.  The staff is friendly, and the seating area for the free breakfast is one of the nicest of any hotel in this price point, an expansive room with high ceilings and plenty of tables, as well as some very comfortable ottoman chairs.  Be sure to ask for the Leisure World discount if you are visiting family members there.  Another nice thing is that they are also welcome to join you for breakfast at the hotel. Easy access to the 405, PCH, and all points in Seal Beach.  Starbucks, Denny's, and Del Taco right next to the hotel.  Also a small outdoor pool that we've never used.  Fitness center is bigger and better equipped than some that I've used at much larger hotels,

Summary Heading: Good place to rest your head
Summary: The hotel itself is modern, well-appointed and clean. The area it is in isn't very nice. It doesn't appear to be a dangerous area, but just a little on the industrial side. Seal beach is just kind of a "blah" part of SoCal.

Spent just one night here but the staff was extremely helpful with dining suggestions and Kimberly even helped me post something to my Instagram.    Hotel is close to Belmont Shore-which was a priority for me.   Room was clean and breakfast was good with a nice variety of foods.   I would definitely stay again.

I stayed at this hotel in July 2015 (and have stayed here previously as well) on a business trip. I really like the location of this hotel because it's 5 mins from work and has several food options in the same parking lot, so they are walking distance (Starbucks, Subway, Japanese). Typical to a Hampton, you don't have to pay for parking, wifi and breakfast are included and the rooms are nice and clean. My only issue is that the road noise is loud on the back side of the hotel; the windows seem to be single pane. It's not that busy a street (and isn't even a highway), but the noise is there. I would recommend getting a room on the front side of the hotel.

Check in was easy, room was clean, WiFi worked well. Was a nice short stay. Parking was free which is becoming increasingly rare. Breakfast was basic but good. The pool area looked clean but I didn't use it.

This hotel is an excellent value, the staff are all welcoming and make sure you have a great stay.  Breakfast is excellent with many choices.  Housekeeping does an excellent job.  Overall property is very clean and well maintained by the maintenance staff.  All should be commended for their customer service

Summary Heading: Lobby remodel is finished, actually great location too!
Summary: Have stayed here before and will again. Reasonable, close to lots of business and the Seal Beach community.  Staff is great, lobby came out great. Plenty of parking, pool is open, room is spacious and comfy.

Beautiful very clean Hotel, with a warm and caring staff. The staff was very accomadating, however they truly need to have a bellman on staff.  Every Hotel should have a bellman!  I'm sure I will return on my next trip to the mainland.

Nice hotel and in a good location near Seal Beach and Long Beach. Rooms are large and clean, and the breakfast is very good. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. I recommend this for individuals and for families.

I will pick this hotel when in the area again in the future. Very pleasant stay. My room was very clean. The bed was wonderful, I had a very good nights sleep. The bathroom was large and updated. Better than I expected based on most hotels I've stayed in.  The location to the downtown of Seal Beach was very convenient as well.  The staff was very helpful with all of my needs. I highly recommend this hotel when in the area.

Awesome rooms, great service, great location.  Morning breakfast was much better than expected. hot fresh.  I like that you can get a fresh cup of coffee at any time..even in the middle of the night. Not happy that this survey is making me write 200 words minimum,,, I think I said enough

Love the hotel, we always pick the Hampton in when we travel in the USA. The front staff is great, very helpful and kind.. We enjoyed every part of our stay. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and helpful as well. The room was clean, parking is great and it is very close to the beach and the Main Street.

the location was perfect for us the room was quiet and large , no mini fridge which i thought was odd but the bed was comfortable and that is a huge thing for me , i have to have a comfy bed and the room was clean and lots of plug ins which in some hotels are hard to find .

Great place to stay - fabulous staff!.  The complimentary breakfast was exceptional and coffee, tea or cocoa was available 24/7.  Rooms very clean. Pool was well kept up.  Location is close enough to many of southern California's amusement parks - Disney World, Knotts Berry Farm to name a few.  Very close to the beach

Nice staff, odd parking, some areas outdated.  Loud air conditioning in the room. Convenient to Long Beach and Huntington Beach, Costa Mesa, etc.  If you love Del Taco there is one nested up to the hotel.

Arrived to find they had automatically upgraded our room because we were Hilton Diamond members.  Usually have to ask for an upgrade.  The room was very nice.  Carpet and furniture seemed new.  Nice kitchenette and plenty of room for 2 people.  The tub surround didn't appear as new but was certainly very clean.  Great  stay.

This is an excellent Hampton. Great location, friendly competent staff, and very clean rooms. Access to Huntington Beach and Long Beach via PCH is great. The reason this Hampton did not get 5stars from me was the breakfast. More fresh fruit, more juice choices, more bread choices. Just go to the Ayres if you want to see your competition. And this is a management decision, not an employee. Overall, I will continue to come back, but not for the food or drink. At least, there is a Starbucks just across the parking lot. Hope next time we come there is an effort to upgrade breakfast. I have been in over 100 different Hamptons and this breakfast ranks in worst ever category.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was close to work location. A Starbucks's in just a few steps away. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and plenty for dinning options in the area.

This is a great hotel with easy access to all of Long Beach and surrounding areas. Everything about the stay was excellent. Staff were very good and the breakfast was good considering it was complimentary.

Worst canned orange juice I've ever had. Isn't California THE citrus state?!  I have to make 200 words minimum to submit this, so I'll fill the rest of the review with some meaningless chatter...oranges oranges please give me at least some orange juice concentrate.

every time we visit family in California, the beach is always on the agenda and the Hampton Inn at Seal Beach is always the place to stay because it's the best!!!!! after trying out a few around the area, this one is always clean, comfortable, quiet, and reasonable. looking forward to our next trip down there.

Excellent facilities. All fresh linens including the bed spread. Great Neutrogena toiletries.  Enjoyed hot breakfast every morning with make your own waffles, fresh coffee, oatmeal, pastries, omelets, potatoes and fruit. That saved us lots of time and money.  Centrally located and near all restaurants and stores too. We also enjoyed the pool.  We would definitely stay here again.

Very good stay.  Convenient location and the staff were top notch.  The breakfast provided was a treat each morning and the items rotated throughout the stay.  Shopping was convenient as  was the beach access.

Summary Heading: Everything was really great ... except the internet
Summary: This hotel was awesome - very clean, good location, really great breakfast. The only downside was the very slow internet. I had business audio and video files I needed to send, so it created a real hassle for me. But the staff was really helpful, so that made up for it. Almost!

The hotel is nice, clean, and for our purposes, close to our kids and grandchild, in Long Beach. Why we give it an excellent rating is the staff; their competence, friendliness, and quality of their service.

Be sure to find out if there is construction before you register.  You could be served breakfast in the dust and confusion of installing new tile in the main entrance and dining room.  Also, check out the air conditioner as it turns on automatically.  The initial  noise of each turn on can be quite loud in room 416.  It is enough to wake a person each time.

We stay in Hampton Inns because the quality of service, cleanliness, and locations are reliable. Staff is always courteous and helpful.  The location of the hotels affords quiet without being too far away from attractions, restaurants etc. We like Seal Beach because it is close to the ocean and our family.  The value for our stay is great.

I stay at this hotel monthly for work reasons although if given the choice I would not.  The hotel is like all other Hampton Inns except they don't provide mini fridge or microwave. They will hold items in a fridge downstairs but that is an inconvenience. Door locks only work sometimes (you have to hold the key at a specific angle and speed to operate the lock) and rooms are warm and stuffy when you enter.

We stayed here for the Long Beach Grand prix Indy car race and it was a short 15 minute drive to the track and with the restaurant Spaghtettini's so close it was a great place to stay .  Rooms were nice and staff were excellent

Really liked our stay. I usually stay at cypress Ca location but they were sold out.  So we booked the suite in seal bch Ca. We were very happy with room as it was extremely clean and suite was very roomy.  With sitting area bar/ counter and nice size work desk area.  Liked microwave and fridge. Desk work station and executive chair was a big hit for my wife who needed a few hours of work.

Rooms somewhat small and no micro-way or refrigerator.  Very clean rooms. Not as close to the Beach as lead to believe. This part of 200 words minimum is really a pain in he you know what.  If I had known that I would have to write beyond what I needed to say I would have not started this survey.

Hotel was clean, quiet and friendly,  located about 10 minutes drive from main restaurant areas of Seal beach and Huntington Beach.  Easy to reach from       I-405.  Everything worked as it should have and had no complaints in a 4 days stay.  Would stay there again

They offer a discount if you are visiting someone at Leisure World, which I do. I didn't give it an Excellent rating because the rooms could be a little cleaner. Mostly they are fine but I notice lots of dust in the corners by the beds and sometimes hair in the bathroom. This is just picky me and I know if I called down they'd immediately send someone up to take care of anything I had an issue with. Service by the staff has always been excellent and professional. The free breakfast buffet is good and they have a good selection to choose from. The gym is a bit small but will do in a pinch :) Overall I am satisfied and that's why I stay there every time I come.

Hotel was great.  Room spacious, clean,  very accommodating.  Location was perfect for what we needed.  Excellent facilities for business or leisure travel.   Only stayed one night but all was exactly what we needed.  Bedding great!!!!

Summary Heading: Great Option to stay at Seal Beach
Summary: Great installations, Close to the Beach with easy access to Highway too. Great Food. And Swimming Pool conditions are great. Friendly Personnel at the hotel. Close to different kind of restaurants, there are several options to choose from if you want to try something different meanwhile you are hanging out in the city.

We really enjoyed the hotel and the service. The pool was very clean. The room was spacious and comfortable. There was a lot of selection for breakfast. I also appreciated the grab and go breakfast bag, which included a bottle of water. We stayed on the opposite side of the Taco drive through, which I would recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are very happy you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to having you stay with us again, and to continually exceed your expectations.  Thank you again.

Summary: One of two elevators and our floor's ice machine out of order.  Jacuzzi dirty.  Coughing heard through walls.  Construction on building started at 8 am.  Two chairs by the pool.  GM did not seem to be pleased when we complained and took one of two nights off; never apologized or seemed to care about our experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are very sorry your stay with us was unsatisfactory.  Rest assured that the concerns you brought up had been addressed accordingly, and we do appreciate you letting us know.  It is through comments like yours that we are able to continually improve.  Thank you again, and hopefully next time we will be able to provide you the kind of experience we pride ourselves with.

Summary Heading: From staff to rooms great hotel.
Summary: From the minute we walked in.Where greeted right away, All 3 rooms where close per request. All rooms where very clean. The free breakfast is great.Was really surprised at how many choices they had to offer.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We are very happy to hear about your good experience with us.  We hope to see you back, and thank you again!

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for short travel trips
Summary: A perfect place to stoy during short business trips, right size room with kitchen (which I did not used but the amenity was there), clean, fresh, quiet... just right for relaxing, do some work early in the morning enjoying a really good cup of coffee...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Nice hotel, very clean, nice service, good area coincidentally the hotel was under construction (lately everytime we stay at Hampton) Priced way too high Could of stayed at an Extended Stay hotel with full kitchen for the price

Arrived late for check-in and staff was quick and courteous to get us into our room as soon as possible. Room was spotless and smelled so good and clean. Bed was so comfortable and also smelled so good and very clean. Bathroom was also spotless with everything one might need. The hotel appeared to be booked solid, but very well insulated as there was zero noise in the room. Got a very good night's sleep. The furnishings and carpet were clean and smelled great. All in all, this stay, as always at a Hampton, was excellent. We have stayed at other hotel chains and we always come back to Hampton as Hampton NEVER disappoints. You know it's always going to be a good stay. Love this hotel chain and won't stay anywhere else.

Overall, my stay was pleasant and comfortable.  The rooms are quite spacious. The hotel was convenient to the freeway and to businesses near-by, such as Boeing and the naval base.    The breakfasts have some of the standard fare like oatmeal, coffee, waffles, bagels, and fruit.   The staff was really nice and helpful.  While my room did not have a mini refrigerator, the staff provided one for a friend since she had some dietary restrictions.   The hotel is a 5 minute ride to downtown Seal Beach.

This facility is very close to Naples/Long Beach & within walking distance to many wonderful places. Staff is friendly & hotel is clean and comfortable. We walked to the beach from the hotel, walked Seal Beach downtown area. Breakfast had great selection of food.

I like this hotel because it is modern and is not shop worn.   Everything is like new yet including the shower and all the furniture. It is also a very quiet hotel with a modern climate control that shuts down automaticly when it reaches the proper temp. setting.

Summary Heading: Extra service, well above usual Hampton
Summary: For a few room business requirement, we also needed a quiet place to make a quick conference call. Nothing elaborates our time consuming that would warrant reserving a conference room, and this came up out of the blue. They didn't charge us a fee, and we were in and out, no hassle quickly. That's quality service at it's best and earned loyalty fur all future business stays...And maybe even a paid conference in the future! Very friendly from desk. Very "on top of things" breakfast staff. Kudos all around!

overall our stay was a very nice one and we would come back anytime we are in the area, the staff was extremely helpful and accommodating, that's all  you require too much information or comments to post a review,

Summary Heading: First class quality at mid-class price.
Summary: The hotel is attractive, very clean, quiet (despite high occupancy), and the breakfast is excellent in a pleasant room.  It is convenient to many attractions, esp. the beach.  The standard room was spacious, clean, and very quiet.  I plan to stay here many times.

Summary Heading: Our First Stay But Not Our Last!
Summary: We usually stay at another Seal Beach hotel when coming to visit a sister living in the area. Our old "home away from home" was unable to accommodate us on short notice so we chose the Hampton Inn to try. I'm glad we did! The room was large, clean and well appointed. The staff very friendly and the breakfast room was well kept and stocked. Overall a great stay for us.....and perhaps a new "home away from home" in the Seal Beach area!

Everything you would expect from a Hampton Inn Hotel, service was excellent, rooms where clean, room amenities were readily available, breakfast had a nice verity, and staff where friendly and helpful. Location of the Hotel was very accessible to restaurants, business, freeway, and only a short drive to the beach. The only reason I didn’t give this location 5 stars was not mini frig was offered for a long stay in their standard room, not a deal breaker but a nice amenity to have for an extended stay.

This place is comfortable and clean. The people who work there are so nice and helpful. The only problem would be the bed!! It's bouncy and uncomfortable. Oh and the room I was in was kinda noisy. I loved the convenient breakfast. I got a fabulous rate too! I would go back if I had too!
Manager Response: Thank you for review.  We are very pleased you enjoyed your stay.  I'm sorry you had a room that was noisy.  The next time you stay with us, please let me know and I will personally make sure to try to get you a room that is more to your liking.

Summary: Since Seal Beach is a regular business destination for me, this is my preferred location to stay.  From the very first time I was here I’ve continued to have great service.  The rooms are always clean and comfortable, and the staff is very friendly.  And I like the cookies which are baked in the afternoon for the guests.  Access to the property is easy, and there’s plenty of parking.  Even if there’s other cars in the lot due to the businesses which share the area, spaces have freed up when I’ve returned from dinner.  The room I had this time was a handicap-accessible one.  That may’ve been the only one available for me.  The only noticeable differences was the bathroom being much larger, and the hand-rails on the walk-in shower.  Beyond that, it was just another room with a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are very happy you had a nice stay.  We hope to continually be your preferred accommodations.

Summary: This is what a person expects to find when traveling. Nice clean rooms, great staff and a solid list of amenities. Its great to have one less thing to worry about when traveling for work. Its sitiuated in a nice area withing minuets of Long Beach and Huntington Beach. Nice short ride to Long Beach Airport.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review.  Nothing pleases us more to know you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you again, and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: This is a typical Hampton Inn, and I mean that in a good way.  Clean comfortable room, nice staff, decent breakfast, I requested a late check-out and it was granted.  There is a Starbucks and a few fast food places in the same parking lot.  Seal Beach is a few minutes away.  A nice stay and I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are very please you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you, and we look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary: Hotel was nice, staff friendly, room was comfortable. Close to Main Street in Seal Beach witch has a number of Irish bars and a few great dining options. Overall a nice place to call home for the five nights I stayed. Only drawback was parking lot really full, way too many spaces reserved for Honors members that were vacant.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are very happy you enjoyed your extended stay with us.  I'm sorry to hear about your challenge with parking.  We also have parking at both sides of the building, and entry doors.  For next time, we can try and get a room on either end, if that would make parking easier and of course, if that is something you would like.  We look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary: Sparkling clean Hotel, Friendly Staff, Breakfast  was a the usual hotel breakfast(saves on your travel budget) The location  is perfect for a family  of Beach Bums from Arizona. Just a short distance from beaches! Be back when the weather warms up! Born 2 Roam!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are pleased you had a great stay with us, and we are happy to hear you like our location.  We too are looking forward to the warmer weather, and having you stay with us again!

Summary: Clean, very accommodating, friendly and nice rooms. We will definitely be staying here again! They have cookies at check in and there is a subway and del taco in the same lot, very convenient. They are also very close to tons of eateries, to many to chose from!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are very happy you enjoyed your stay with us!  We look forward to having you stay with us again, and continually meet your expectations!

Summary: It was a great experience - would recommend to family and friends. Excellent price for the amenities. The breakfast the serve is very convenient and the staff was always friendly. However having to write a minimum of 200 charaters is a little annoying.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  Nothing pleases us more than to hear you had a great experience!  We hope to see you back soon!

Summary Heading: Superb Stay at Seal Beach Hampton Inn
Summary: The entire staff was helpful and pleasant. A refrigerator and additional towels were delivered to our quiet, clean room within minutes of our arrival. Wonderful buffet breakfast that was slightly different each morning. The breakfast attendant kept the buffet area immaculate and well stocked and was so pleasant and cheerful. Really exceptional customer service in a very nice, relaxing hotel. Lobby is very warm and inviting. I wouldn't change a thing about this hotel! We stay once per year over the winter holiday and look forward to staying at this Hampton Inn each year.
Manager Response: Thank you so much!  We love hearing from our returned guests, and we are happy that we are able to meet your expectations each time. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Stayed here for two nights while visiting family in the area.  The 3rd floor room was very nice, including a large closet, desk, fold out couch, easy chair, and a king size bed.  The included basic kitchen included microwave, small fridge, and a sink but know utensils.  The towels were full and fluffy, but the shower nozzle needed replacing as the adjustable spray head didn't adjust properly and the spray was minimal.  The included breakfast was great, including waffles, eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal etc.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay close to the beach.
Summary: This is a nice hotel, fresh rooms, nicely appointed and free breakfast. Had a very good night's sleep every day! Didn't use the gym or pool facilities but they looked nice. The breakfast was lacking a little in the eggs and bacon but all the other items were great.

Breakfast was the bomb.  Yummy omelets and waffles.  Coffee was great too.  The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was great as there were restaurants and shopping within walking distance.  Would highly recommend this hotel.

I checked in early and got a room on the first floor which was quiet and clean. The people working reception were polite and friendly.The design of the hotel is different than other Hampton's. Rooms are long and narrow and the open breakfast area has high beams, more east coast looking than west coast! Coffee/tea 24 hours which is nice. My room had a walk in shower and no tub. Very nice sheets which is a plus for me and my standards. Typical breakfast with lots of mid level workers from nearby company or gov't. Secure building and good parking.

Located off the PCH via 405 this is  a good little hotel in Seal Beach. The hotel has a coffee shop and a restaurant nearby. Good $ value. If you aren't into upscale $ star this is a good 3 star Hotel. Easy trip to HB and to Seal Beach. Walter

Room clean, breakfast is really a lot of choices.  I did not give an excellent rating because that evening the hot tub was pretty scummy.  The pool was clean, though.  Would stay again and hope hot tub is better this time.  I stayed two years ago and hot tub was clean.

Everything turned out as expected. Clean room, attentive service, central location (don't expect beach front), nice breakfast (permanent refill and clean up). I love to stay at Hampton Inn's because you know what you get before you get there.

We stayed here for 3 nights while our house was being fumigated.  The hotel is fairly new and we received excellent service.  Their beds are extremely comfortable, which is consistent with most Hampton Inns.  We would highly recommend.

A very nice place to stay. A little out of the way but quiet and convenient to town, beach, shopping and restaurants. The staff was very helpful. Complimentary breakfast was fair... good enough to start your day and the coffee was good! No in-house restaurant. I would definitely stay there again as it was a good value. Also... free parking a plus!

I would recommend to anyone visiting this area to choose this hotel, the entire facility was clean close to all the attraction S. Cal has to offer and near major highways. Staff were very courteous and helpful, continental breakfast was great.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for your beach stay
Summary: This is my hotel of choice when visiting the Long Beach/Seal Beach area.  Conveniently located near the freeways, shopping centers, restaurants and a short drive from the beach. Very friendly staff, cleaning crew and reasonably priced. This is a wonderful hotel to return to after spending a day at the beach.

We have stayed here numerous times and have always experienced excellent staff and accommodations.  The location is perfect for visiting the Seal Beach/Long Beach and surrounding southern California areas.  A great place to use as your home base when visiting this area.

Hotel is close to the airport, however not noisy, which is very important to me! parking  is not a problem and very easy and safe. Very close to 405/22 Freeways. Enough to eat for breakfast! Rooms are very nice.It is a pleasant surprise to have coffee, tea and some fruit available all day long. Eating out is not a problem either! Would definitely  stay again. Staff is very helpful and very friendly and kind. Just a bit expensive, make use of the gym and the pool area.

Staying at a Hampton Inn there are certain things that I expect. Those being friendly faces, Clean room a good breakfast and a cookie at the end of my day. I get all of these at which ever Hampton I stay, this is why I choose Hampton's.

excellent customer service, comfortable bed, huge shower, super clean, great breakfast. friendly and caring.  i will use hilton/hampton again in my next travels. no matter which one i stay in it is consistent.

This motel has a special rate if you are visiting someone in Leisure World @ Seal Beach.  It is about a 3 minute drive from the Leisure World complex.  The motel is quiet and pleasant.  Staff is helpful and efficient.  We were very happy with our stay and would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Comfortable room and a good value
Summary: Easy reservation process with the hotel's staff which I really appreciate.  No question about the price I'd need to pay.  Room was clean and ready when we arrived and the personnel were very pleasant and helpful.  Terrific breakfast and several hot choices which was nice too.  Like the availability of coffee when we arrived, nice touch.

My stay was a pleasant experience it was close to everything we wanted to see in the area. The weather was delightful the temperature was just right. We did not have a chance to use all of the amenities there just was not enough time

We stayed at the Hampton Inn Seal Beach because it is a comfortable 30 min drive from LAX about half way to our main destination and not far off of I5.  It  has complimentary parking and breakfast, and has the most comfortable beds.  This was our second stay and this hotel is clean, comfortable, and the staff are very friendly.  Will stay here again.

Summary Heading: A room that gives you the feeling of home!
Summary: Our hotel suite stay was everything, and more than we had expected in size, cleanliness, and comfort.  We even had adequate room to entertain family guests from across the hall.  You are truly missing a treat if you don't check out the Hampton Inn at Seal Beach.

I stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites Seal Beach for 8 days while I was looking for an apartment after moving into the area. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel: the beds are super comfy, the breakfast is great and has something for everyone, the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming...I could go on and on.  And the value is great; what you get for an unbelievably reasonable price is wonderful! Bottom line: this hotel felt like home when I was almost 3,000 miles away from home. It was a great start to beginning my life in a new city. Thank you so much HI&S Seal Beach!!  :)

This hotel, though small, is in a great location right between Orange County and Los Angeles County.  I have always had a pleasant stay here and would stay here again.  The breakfast is not great, but typical for this type of hotel.  Beach is just a few miles away, as is the freeway for easy access anywhere.

our daughter left behind, her pillow and both her rings. We called the front desk and they went to our room retrieved our items. When we got back to the hotel (cuz we were just 5 mins up the freeway) they had them for us. HI is always so great, clean and helpful.

On a recent visit to Seal Beach we stayed at the Hampton Inn. We found it to be quite a pleasant stay. The room was spacious and very clean, especially the bedding. The duvet covers are changed for each guests stay and so the bed was very clean and very comfortable. The breakfast that was included was good and had a variety of hot and cold foods to choose from. The entire property was well maintained. It is in a good location off the freeway and it is about a 5 minute ride from Main Street where there are many nice shops and restaurants and at the end of the street is a pier which extends out over the Pacific. We would stay there again if our plans include a visit to Seal Beach.

Although it was a bit difficult to find (the hotel address is not in MapQuest), I found the hotel to be comfortable, clean, and for my purpose very well located. The room I got was large, quiet, and very importantly very clean. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. There is free internet access, and breakfast (alternatively, there is a Starbucks across the parking lot). This is a nice hotel where I plan to stay again, and have already recommended it to my colleagues.

I was able to check in on arrival and the staff was very helpful and assisted me with directions to a wedding in the area. It was a little more expensive than an online reservation, but I wanted to make sure other family members were at the same hotel.

Overall a fair place to stay. Not a five star hotel but clean and comfortable. Breakfast was minimal but eatable. Did not partake in the pool or gym. Did use the “business center” (loosely used term) but convenient and easy, only on terminal worked. Very close to Starbucks which is always a good thing.

This Hampton Inn is as dependably nice as any I've ever stayed at.  It is conveniently located to the 405 and PCH.  The beds are awesome, as they always are at Hampton Inns.  I would definitely stay here again if I get back in the area.

Summary Heading: Hampton Seal Beach good but overpriced
Summary: good but overpriced.  nothing in the area within driving distance.  new, bland basic Hampton priced like a beach hotel.  nothing wrong (friendly staff, clean hotel), but way over priced for a standard Hampton miles from anything.

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay
Summary: The room was spacious and clean.  My view out the window was of the Del Taco and Denny's next door, which wasn't that bad during the daylight hours.  But the lights from those establishments (and the street lights) couldn't be blocked out because the shades were stuck in the open position.  The full-length mirror on the closet door was a nice touch, but the bathroom door covers it when opened.  Perhaps could've gone for a different design which complimented each other better.  Would've liked a fridge in the room, too.  Bed was clean and comfortable.  Outside pool was nice.  Gym was very tiny.  Snack selection by the front desk was small.  The complimentary hot breakfast was nice, and it varied each day.  WiFi connection was extremely poor during the evening hours, and many times

I feel I was discriminated at my arrival and check in, after staying at Hilton more than 80 nights in past 12 months, I did not deserve to be treated bad. As a gold member and more than 260000 points for the first time  I had to ask the receptionist use my points and upgrade me to a room which is available for check in at 1pm.

Was perfect for a one night get away with the wife that was close to the beach but not too expensive!It was perfect for that and the complimentary breakfast was one of the better ones that i have been to.

I stayed at this hotel on business and I can say that I was very pleased with this hotel.  It was probably one of the more comfortable beds I have stayed in and knowing the comforter was washed prior to my stay made it even more comforting.

Summary Heading: another reliable Hilton property, perfect location
Summary: Land in Long Beach airport and be here in 20 minutes. Starbucks, Subway, etc literally next door. Hilton's online check-in/room choice (keys waiting at the desk) is perfect. Cleanliness, upkeep is top notch-it's all about the employees there. I notified Front Desk on way out one day that the smoke detector was beeping; I returned earlier than expected and found it was fixed, but then had a knock on the door.
