Peter from Engineering/Maintenance notified me that housekeeping had spotted that the bathroom ceiling light was malfunctioning; he swapped out the ballast (bulb was fine) and we chatted for a few minutes. That's what counts. I'm really reaching out here for a criticism-laundry room has 1 washer, but 2 dryers? Didn't bother me anyway.

We stayed at Seal Beach Hampton Inn for a wedding.  It was great value, being a short drive to Seal Beach & Main Street, and not far from other beaches as well.  The kids loved the breakfasts and the staff were super helpful.

I stayed here for business, but would stay here for pleasure too.  I enjoyed the stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone that is traveling for business or pleasure. The staff was friendly and helpful.  Was close to great restaurants and bars.

We had a wonderful long weekend visiting our son in Long Beach.   We stayed across the bay in Seal Beach at the Hampton Inn and Suites.   The hotel was a well kept, quiet, secure, and had plenty of free parking area.   The staff was very friendly and overall a nice place to stay.   It was convenient to 2nd St in Long Beach where all the restaurants are and we enjoyed a great kayaking adventure around Naple's Island for $9/hr.  It also is a short trip to Huntington Beach and the wild life preserve.

1. Large room 2. Lots of standard amenities 3. Complementary hot breakfast (full spread) 4. Free internet.  5. Comfortable bed 6. Clean rooms 7. Close but not too close to the freeway ...what else can you ask for at such a great price!

This Hampton lived up to all my brand expectations except for one little thing.  I arrived quite late and the window was open.  Due to that, the room was very warm.  Unfortunately, I couldn't get the window closed and the front desk person said they had to wait until someone could cover the desk to come help me.  I was too tired for all that so I just cranked the AC higher.  Otherwise, I was very happy.  Comfortable bed and linens, clean, friendly staff.

The hotel looks really nice.  Worst beds I have ever slept in.  The pool area is cluttered with trash in the bushes and all of the hotel pool furniture is broken.  The mesh in all the chairs ripped or yucky.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel close to Seal Beach
Summary: You can't beat the proximity of this hotel to Seal Beach, California. There is an independent hotel on PCH closer to downtown seal beach, and if you look at the area near the Hampton, it doesn't look like much (it faces a Naval weapons depot). But having stayed at both hotels in Seal Beach, the Hampton is cleaner, more spacious, and has a better breakfast and keeps hot coffee on all day. We were a five minute drive from main street seal beach and I never had to fight for a parking spot (which can happen when you stay at the hotel in downtown Seal Beach).  And there's a starbucks across the parking lot.

Hotel is OK. cable TV is OK. Get a suite, the regular rooms are BLA. Prices are high due to businesses travels filling rooms. It's a hampton so you can't expect high end.   Cable is limited but good. I like the location. You can't walk to the beach or anything from here.

Your bed sheets with duvet and pillows were clean, fresh and comfortable.  Room as well is cleaned.  Housekeeping may just have to be more detailed of other guest's trash left in the room - found (and left in there) a bottle of  empty wine inside the closet.

This motel was comfortable and clean.  Did not offer any of the usual discounts, i.e., AAA, senior, etc and the room was slightly pricey.  Refrigerators in the rooms were not standard.  They were available, but had to be asked for and then you have to go through the process of waiting to have one brought to your room.

Have stayed in a lot of hotels when traveling.  This Hampton Inn is in a great location and very affordable.  The employees were very friendly and made you feel very welcomed.  The breakfast was also great.  Will definitely stay again when in the area.

We needed a place to stay that was close to Seal Beach.  While it was a ways from downtown it suited our needs perfectly.  Long Beach Marina was a great place for restaurants for dinner.  The room was comfortable, breakfast was free.  What more can you ask for?

Francis was very nice ... this was a very nice stay. The lobby was nice ... very nice decor. The water was hot and pressure was good ... The location was good ... in a shopping plaza with a Subway sandwich shop. Plenty of outlets. The bed was "okay."  The pillows were horrible. I would stay here again. : -)

Had a fabulous time.  Located a short drive to the beach.  The hotel was recommended by our friends who were staying during the 4th of July weekend.  The breakfast was great, rooms were comfortable and quiet.  Front Desk staff was very nice and accommodating.

I stayed 4 nights in a normal room (not a suite), enjoyed my stay. The room was clean, quiet, and as cool as I wished. Breakfast was great, available at 9 AM, the variety and quality was good (oatmeal, nuts, yogurt, fruit for me).  Plenty of parking in front of the hotel, with a Starbucks, Subway, and Teriyaki restaurant across the parking lot. The location is convenient, near the 405 freeway, just a few miles from Seal Beach pier, and Long Beach.

Staff was very friendly.  Room was clean.  Breakfast was good.  Only complaint was we would have liked to have a frig &/or microwave in our room.  We originally booked a 5 night stay and having a frig would have been nice.  Other than that, the hotel was wonderful.

This hotel is very convenient for us when visiting family, but it has a worn and tired feel.  It seems that maintenance is a little behind.  There were chips in the ceramic tub, the closet door latch mechanism was broken and the lock on the door wouldn't lock.

My fiancé and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel and were very pleased!  We had the King suite with Jacuzzi tub.  The room was very spacious and so was the bathroom.  The Jacuzzi and shower both were big enough for 2!  The bed was cozy and comfortable.  Very friendly staff and complimentary breakfast too.  Room was very clean.  We would stay here again!

Family of 5 traveling from North Dakota, just leaving LAX after a long day of traveling.  This hotel was very welcoming when we checked in at midnight, gave us directions to a Little Ceasars for some quick dinner and got us checked in right away.  The room was really nice, clean and spacious.  Woke up to an amazing breakfast for the whole family without leaving the hotel!  Would definitely stay again!

We were on a family vacation for 3 days. We rented 3 rooms. The rooms were nice, clean, and quiet.  The suites are more spacious with a couch, and mini kitchen which is nice.  The beds were very comfortable. We will stay here again.

I enjoyed my stay at this Hampton.  It was close to Seal Beach and it was very clean and new.  Plenty of good restaurants nearby.  A bit hard to find if you are new to the area and not in my GPS database.  Also road construction on my return trip to LAX led me to detours that were difficult to follow.  Would liked to have known about the road work before I left the hotel for LAX.  Food was good for the typical Hampton breakfast.  Coffee was good and hot food each day was acceptable.

Nice, clean, quiet hotel.  Very good complimentary breakfast.  Comfy bed and pillows!  Would definitely stay here again.  Nice/useful amenities if traveling on business- complimentary Wi-Fi, multiple and convenient electrical outlets and lighting, desk and bed tray/table. Only issue: ac a bit noisy.

On a scale of 1 - 10, Hampton always get a perfect score 10,  I stay at Hamptons because there are never been any bad experiences in 20 some years.  The staff is always there to greet you, make your stay away from home a delight, I have found the staff members at what Hampton I am at to be courteous and willing to help in anyway they can to make your stay a pleasant one. Thanks and I will be back

I've probably stayed at 100 Hampton Inns  across the U.S. And Canada.  This is one of the nicer places I've seen. Spotless clean, friendly and helpful staff, nice breakfast. My only complaint is a lack of available parking on property, I was forced to park in the adjoining shopping strip lot, not a big deal, but when you pay for a room, you expect to get a parking place.

We recently stayed at this Hampton Inn & Suites while making a quick trip to CA.  As usual, Hampton Inn did not disappoint.  Our room was comfortable and clean and the breakfasts were a little different each of the 3 days that we were there.  The only slight problem that we encountered was a broken closet door that would not remain closed which was not a big issue.  I brought it to the attention of the staff and they said that they could have it repaired then or after we left.  I told them that after we left would be fine, as it was not a big problem. The room we had selected was a room with 2 queen size beds because of the fact that there were 3 of us staying there.  I was a little disappointed that our room did not have a refrigerator.  When I asked the girl at the front desk

I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is in the Seal Beach, CA area.  It is very clean and at a excellent location.  Close to the beach and Disney.  The hotel does not charge for parking and there are plenty of restaurants close by.  The beach is about 5 miles away and is only a 10 minute drive.  Disney would be about 15 minutes away.    The breakfast was very good and plenty of selections.

I have been staying at this Hampton Inn about once month for the past 4 years, as I visit Seal Beach very frequently for work. Every time I stay here, I get good service, a good night's sleep, and a decent breakfast. It is a very clean hotel with very courteous staff. The location is good and it is a good value. If you are looking for some 5 star all inclusive resort, this is not it. If, however, you are looking for a clean well run hotel amd a good night's sleep, look no further.

The Hotel is a typical Hampton Inn.  As is normal with this brand of hotel you know what to expect.  Service was excellent, Staff was friendly and helpful, Rooms were clean and quiet.  Property was well maintained.  I did not experience any issues.  You have to be quick in the afternoons when the cookies are put out, or they will gone before you know it!

Summary Heading: Good value, but missed having a fridge and microwave
Summary: Our family tried the Hampton Inn & Suites during a weekend trip to the Anaheim-Disney area. We wanted to combine the trip with a couple of beach days. This property was well placed for trying to accomplish both things. I did feel that the reservation situation was confusing and ended up being a disappointment in one respect. We really wanted a fridge and microwave and thought that at the Inn & Suites we could get one and had one reserved. When we got there, they were sold out and our room didn't have one. :(  The breakfast was only "okay," but the staff are helpful and pleasant. There is a Subway and a sushi place across the street. The room was clean, but the night was not quiet. There were a lot of running teens and children in the early morning and in the evening.

Great value, awesome location, very clean, and overall friendly stay. We love the breakfast, the pool, the wifi and the people. It was Our 2nd stay at this location, and we will be back next visit to Orange County. The beach is close along with being close to the major freeway 405.

Quite good place in Seal Beach, close to Boeing and other high technology companies. Breakfast is just so so. Air Conditioner is quite noisy.  Public Traffic is inconvenience, have to rent a car. There are Subway and Starbucks nearby.  Not all room equipped with a refrigerator. Front desk may arrange if there are any spares available.

We usually love Hampton Inns, but this one didn't live up to expectations.  Our room was clean and comfortable, but not at all quiet. The hotel seemed poorly constructed- paper thin walls and floors creaked like they were wood floors so you could hear every movement (There was what sounded like a herd of elephants above us and the group of kids in the room beside us were very loud.) We could hear kids running up and down the halls, (hello, where are the parents or team leaders???) and we just didn't have a very relaxing time, which was unfortunate, as we'd had a long travel day and just wanted to sleep.  We went down to breakfast early and it was good, but there were sport teams also up early so again, not a quiet time.  If you're looking for peace and quiet- this hotel isn't

This is a very up scale hotel and a very reasonable price.  The staff were very accomodating and pleasent.  I was inpressesed that they could call me by name.  The rooms were very clean and nice. The food was good. There was nothing that was out of place or not good about our experience.

Our family chose to stay at the Seal Beach Hampton because of its location.  It provided easy access to many area attractions.  We were also close to Orange Beach John Wayne Airport.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable.  I love the comfort of their beds!  The breakfasts are fantastic - Extensive choices are available.  The staff was pleasant and accommodating.  I would gladly stay at this location again.

I have stayed here before and will, definitely, be staying at this hotel and others with the same name in the future. The daily breakfast spread is great and changes slightly daily.  The always ready coffee is helpful.  The front desk people are always ready with a smile and remember me like I am somebody.  The rooms are always clean.  Close to everything.  good parking.  Overall good

When I travel to the beach area, I stay at the Hampton in Seal Beach, the rooms are always clean and fresh and the staff is always willing to help. So for your next vist to Seal Beach which only a short drive to Huntington and Long Beach why not stay at the Seal Beach Hampton.

This is a great location for me to stay, as my freinds lives in Long Beach and we like to have a fun night out once a month. Since I live so far away from Long Beach I like to stay at this Hampton Inn, because of the location and the staff is so friendly and I feel very safe here!

Loved our first stay at a Hampton Inn, and Seal Beach. Took my wife for a quick couples retreat to Seal Beach and thoroughly enjoyed our time int he Hotel, and the surrounding community. It was a last minute booking, and the front desk was very accommodating. Upon checking, we were presented with freshly baked cookies, and the staff eagerly fulfilled our first request ..more towels and pillows. The hotel staff were prompt in the delivery of our request, and very cordial during our brief interaction.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at a very nice Hotel
Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel for the business traveler or for personal travel. It is close to pretty much everything you need and is very clean and comfortable. Excellant value. Signed, Rich  from Tucson

This hotel is located near Main Street (where there are a lot of shops and places to eat) and Seal Beach. Great service and rooms are very clean. If you need a place to stay; it is easily accessible from the 405 and close to Knott Berry Farm and Disneyland and Downtown Disney!

I have an excellent stay with lots of places to eat and a wonderful people.  With this Hotel and its staff you can always count on. Upon arrival I'm all set with the key handed to me without filling out several forms and staff was courteous enough and made sure I'm all set. Staff also had asked if I need a wake up call the following morning. I thought that was a very nice feeling from the staff to insure I wake up on time.

Room was quiet and clean, bed was comfortable.  Staff was polite but not as cheerful as other hotels I've stayed in.  Not a whole lot to do on the South side of the 405, a few odds and ends around.  Gym was average, breakfast was OK.  If you like the Starbucks style oatmeal, their oatmeal bar is for you!  Parking was conveniently right outside hotel, a bit crowded but I was able to find a spot not too far away.

I enjoyed the hotel and am glad that MSF recommended it and arranged for us to stay there. Another good thing was that ATT WIFI access was available and I did not have to use the Hotel WIFI. It kept failing. Everything else about the hotel was very good in my opinion.

Just seemed like a very average hotel for a lot money during the off season. Elevators were incredibly slow. Front desk staff needed to be educated on how a "Pay when you stay" reservation worked.  Sincerely. Anthony

Hotel was very average, with the exception of the beds, which were very comfortable.  We had heating/cooling problems in our room and had to move.  Staff took a long time handling the problem and we had to go back and check to see what they were going to do about it.  No one was especially friendly, they went about their business as if we weren't there.

Stayed here twice. First time was great. Second time was not. Asked if it would be possible to upgrade to a larger suite. Was told our prepaid reservation disallowed any changes, even though I was willing to pay for the upgrade. Never met a company unable to take a customer's money, and then to argue with the customer about it. Made no sense then and makes no sense now.

Seal Beach Hampton was my home for one week of business travel.  They are very nice at this property and all was in order.  The room was fresh, clean and well presented.  My room was extra quiet and much appreciated – on third floor.  The breakfast ‘lady’ was wonderful and more than expected helpful.  For me this property was well located and a great place to work from for a week.

I needed a hotel that was close to my office and the Hampton Inn was only 5 minutes away.  This is my first time at a Hampton Inn and I was pleasantly surprised.  No, this is not a Four Seasons, W, or Fairmont, but for the value I had an excellent stay.  The free breakfast was a nice touch, the pool + hot tub area was vacant the entire time (had it all to myself) and the front desk staff were incredibly friendly and always said hello and remembered my name (which I was impressed by).  In fact I am returning there in just a few days for my second stay.  I never found parking to be an issue and it was easy to navigate the area to get food, gas, etc.

Summary Heading: Not the same as other Hampton Inn's
Summary: First thing at check in was a warning about smoking in your room and a fine of $250 if you did. Not much of a welcome! I am a smoker and never smoke in a room or my own home for that matter, found this statement to be very offensive. I have stayed in many Hampton Inn's all across this country and have never experienced this kind of treatment at any other Hampton before. I might add that the free breakfast at this estabilishment was very sub-standard by comparision to other Hampton Inn's. Also, parking for this Hampton is shared by a medium sized shopping center making parking a problem. Room amenities were also sub-standard, by comparision to other Hamptons elsewhere. Beware!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor.  I believe I spoke to you upon your departure.  Again, I apologize that our non-smoking policy took away from your experience.  As I have explained, our smoking policy is on the registration card which reads "A fee up to $250 USD will be assessed for smoking in a non-smoking room.  Please ask the Front Desk for locations of designated outdoor smoking areas."  We require our guests, all of our guests to sign and initial the registration card upon check-in.  We thought it best that we inform our guests what they are signing.  It is certainly not our intention to offend anyone, nor do we single out any of our guests with this policy since we do let all of our guests know about our policy.  As I have told you, I will address it with the team just the same, which I have.  Thank you for bringing it to my attention, and we will make sure to choose our words upon informing our guests about our policy.

Summary: Great value, good breakfast, and good location. Room was clean, beds were comfortable. Staff was friendly (for the most part) and the parking was adequate. Restaurants near by were good and the gas station was close.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  Nothing makes us happier than seeing our guests enjoy their stay with us, and also thank you for Jesse's compliment.  A good, positive feedback from our guests comes a long way with the team's morale.

Summary: I stay here on business trips every few weeks and have found the staff helpful, efficient, and very friendly. They definitely strive for quality customer service. The rooms are good size and the furnishings and linens are in good shape. The rooms are always clean and the WiFi and cable TV is never a problem. You can't beat the free breakfast spread, which is huge, the decent exercise room, the outdoor pool (which I have never used), and convenient no- valet free parking. There is a [big name] coffee shop across the parking lot along with a well-known sandwich franchise. Easy on-off of 405 freeway and those warm cookies at 5 PM make this a location I always return to.

Summary Heading: Nice Place to Inside and out
Summary: I have stayed here a few times and it is our get away from home. Love the area and the things to do that are close to the hotel. Everyone was nice and helpful. I will always come back to this place because i feel secure and treated like i belong there

I would've liked to give this hotel 5 stars but couldn't because I had a bad experience and I wouldn't recommend it to anybody.  The staff was very nice, it's in a wonderful location just a short drive from PCH and Seal Beach.  I was in a nice King Suite and it was very clean and the bed was cozy and comfortable, but the walls must be terribly thin because it sounded like there were a herd of elephants staying above me.  I came from Seattle for a nice, relaxing getaway and that wasn't what I had.  I was awakened early every day and often kept up late as well.  It's nobody's fault; I've just never stayed in a hotel where I could hear every step the people above me took.  One of the reasons I stayed here is a friend lives close by and I told her not to recommend it when she has

Very nicely laid out, updated, and  large room. Lots of outlets which I need.  Near places to eat. Would stay here again. Stayed here on business, easy in and out. TV located on outside wall, so you do not disturb neighbors.

We needed somewhere to stay for a short visit with grandkids.  They loved the room, and pool.  It was very enjoyable for all of us.  The staff was johnny on the spot for anything we needed.  We were very satisfied with the whole hotel.

Summary Heading: Not what it use to be
Summary: Hampton Inn use to be my 'go to' hotel when I needed a place that was warm, clean, value priced  and charming in a way. All those 'smart' marketing boys at Hilton who took over this chain years ago, have successfully "Monsanto-tized" this operation. Sure it's clean and all that but it no longer has the small touches that the old Hampton Inn had. Fewer cute signs, no more pillow selection, the breakfast fare is just disgusting. Poor quality concentrated orange juice which is not even good for you. Jelly/jam that that has more corn syrup than fruit. I guess it's what Americans like! Sterilised environments to the point of being just boring. For the price I paid, it was too much. THe guy at the front dest told me the price was high because they got a lot of business people there!

Love this hotel, very clean and comfortable.  Large bathrooms, comfy beds.  Great price with advanced purchase.  Better than most hotels in the area. Nice workout room and pool. Convenient location to downtown  Seal Beach.

I stayed one night. The room was very nice, clean and quiet. So many hotels are noisy and have thin walls but I did not hear lots of noise in the next rooms or hallways so I was able to sleep without being awakened by noisy guests. The wifi worked fine. The breakfast was ok. Not bad considering it's free. Bonus: there is a Starbucks right across the parking lot! :-). The staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again.

Very good value.  Clean rooms, great fitness & business center & pool.  Great breakfast selection.  Would highly recommend to travelers, whether for business or leisure.  They provide a bag of goodies for those who don't have time for breakfast to eat on the run. Felt safe with security measures in effect.

This is the fourth time I have stayed at the Hampton Seal Beach and every time is enjoyable as the last.  Very quiet, close and easy access to the 405.  Many restaurants both chain and local nearby.  Also nice to be able to walk to a couple of places without getting in the car.

Summary Heading: Great place for quick beach access
Summary: Close to Bolsa Chica wetlands, this its a great place to use your Hilton points.  Far from the crowds of other beaches.  Seal beach and this hotel are a find.  The staff are friendly, its near Boeing where the Apollo flight engines were developed.   Traffic can be irritating at time at the pool, but chill out.

Summary Heading: I felt like a Nubian Queen
Summary: I'm down on business every Thursday, So I'm booked here at the beautiful Hampton Inn. First Class all the way greeted with a warm and very tasteful peanut butter cookie... The red carpet is layed out as soon as I enter the hotel. My room is always very elegant with a jazuzzi tub in the bathroom as well as flat screen television. The bed is so comfortable goose down everything! A queen I truly am for one night once a week! Thank you!

The Hampton Inn is very nice, comfortable, warm facility with reasonable rates for any kind of room.  The free parking allowed friends to visit without the drama of where to park or any time restrictions. The staff is always very welcoming and very attentive to grant whatever request is needed. Once again, the whirlpool suite was heavenly!!! I do plan to stay at other Hampton Inn's in the future.

Had a super stay here.  Very close to the downtown area the beach etc.  Very nice people very clean and nice rooms.  Wifi sucked though.  You do have the option to use a hardwire so it was ok. Standard breakfast.  I would reccommend it.

Was very happy with service and room and location to my business meetings.  It was well kept and very comfortable.  The bed was great! I have stayed at this location before and would definitely return. The proximity to restaurants and amenities was very convenient, Starbuck's in the same parking lot!

room often hot, pool area utilized by large groups of boisterous teenagers performing organized games by their group leader. These activities should have been redirected to one of the empty meeting rooms adjacent to the dining area.

I like staying at the Hiltons hotels because I know they will be clean, safe, and a good price for me. I am on a fixed income so I feel I get more than my money worth. Especially at the Hampton Inns with the free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Started out horrible, they made it right...almost.
Summary: Due to construction at our home, we had to find a hotel room for 3 nights with one day's notice.  We always love Hampton Inns so we found this one which is nearby our home.  We booked one of only 3 rooms available.  It was a king suite with a sofa sleeper.    Upon arriving to our room the first evening, we noticed it was kind of stuffy and humid.  Oh well, no big deal, we thought.  We went to turn the air conditioner on.  The wall control/thermostat didn't work so we went to the unit itself.  Yay, it does work!  We set the thermometer for 75 and went about our showers and getting kids ready for bed.  No bar soap, shampoo or anything near the sink.  Weird, but whatever.   After the 2nd shower, we realized the bathroom vent was not working.  There was no fan.  After four showers,

Summary Heading: Great business hotel in a cool beach town
Summary: For folks on here disappointed because they were expecting a beach resort experience, the very large Navy facility on one side and the Boeing facility on the other should give you a clue. They do alot of business with defense/aerospace people. It also happens to be in one of the nicest small beach towns left in Southern California. Short cab ride to Main street Seal Beach And Los Alamitos marina. Great restaurants and bars. Walt's Wharf, and Joe's Crab Shack. Four Irish pubs on Main street in old town. For couples: The jacuzzi suites are excellent!

Our king suite was very nice! Clean, spacious, and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. I liked this hotel much better than the Hilton Anaheim that we just checked out of! Hot breakfast was served every morning and we were happy the coffee was served all day!

Summary Heading: They don't know how to treat Diamond members!
Summary: Stayed here twice in the last 4 weeks and both times, the experience was negative.  Intentionally did not write a review after the first visit.  Wanted to give them a second chance before I shared my experiences.  I'm a HH Diamond (million plus member).  When I arrived the first time, I asked if I had water in my room.  I was "lectured" by the young man at the desk that my HH choices included points, and NOT water, and property's are different, yada yada yada..... and therefore I'm not eligible for a free bottle of water.  Really?  The case on the counter that says "if you are diamond or gold" please select a free snack and beverage???   And, oh by the way, what does a whole sale bottle of water cost the hotel??  Are not my 100+++ nights per years at HH property's worth $1.29???
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear about your experience, and if you felt like you were "lectured" about your member’s benefits.  That was certainly not our intention.  We do our very best to deliver the Hilton Honors benefits, and if our guests are expecting something different than what their profile is set up for, we simply just want them to know that, and not leave them with the impression that we did not deliver what they thought they were supposed to have.  As you have mentioned, it is not about such a minimal amount of $1.29.  Hilton Honors set up the benefits for their members of different tiers, and at different Hilton properties, from the Waldorf Astoria Brands and ours, the Hampton Brands.  We only follow the guidelines provided to us.  Hilton Honors can assist you with changing your profile should you choose to pick the option of receiving the snacks instead of the points at Hampton Brands.  I will also add the website that has the information about the Hilton Honors Members Benefits.  Please feel free to contact me directly if there is anything else I can address for you.   http://hhonors3.hilton.com/en/explore/benefits/index.html

Summary: I would call this a typical Hampton Inn. It is a newer model so the furnishings are up to date. However I would mention that the carpets on the 3rd floor are showing heavy wear and heavy soiling in serveral traffic areas. Also, the suite chair in my room was uphostered in a lighter color fabric and was heavily soiled, spotted and stained--not a chair I would sit in it was that dirty.   The hotel staff are very helpful, friendly and do an excellent job of supporting the guests. Breakfast was the typical good quality and selection Hampton breakfast.   Good location for venturing out from.

Found everything to be very good. We had a king suite, excellent, with fridge and microwave. Staff were very pleasant. Room clean everything we needed. Good breakfast that was included, buffet style, hot and cold food, including omlettes and potatoes. No complaints, location not bad would have been nice to be closer to seal beach but only 5 to 10 minute drive to main street

The hotel itself was nice and comfortable. Staff would not let us check in unitl 3PM even though an early check-in was requested.  They rushed us out at noon the next day. We did not even stay a full 24 hours. I was there with my 4 sisters for a relaxing over night trip.  After dinner, we went back to our room to enjoy hot tea and dessert. Around 11:30 PM we got a rude call from the front desk telling us to quite down and that we were "partying loud", and "disturbing other guests"  This could not be further from the truth.  We were laughing and enjoying a nice evening. We went to the pool during the day and the trash can was completely over flowing with trash.  No one came by to empty it and it was still filled to the brim the next day.  Also, dirty towels were strewn about the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  I apologize we were not able to accommodate your early check-in request.  We try our very best to accommodate requests, but our hotel was sold out the night before, and the day of your check-in and that is why we were not able to check you in early.  That is also the same case with late check-out.  I looked into your reservation, and it looks like we were able to at least extend your check-out to 12:30pm.  We want all of our guests to enjoy their stay with us, and when we get complaints, we investigate and look into it ourselves.  I apologize if the wordings were offensive to you, and I will address it with the team, but again we only try to make all of our guests happy.  Our coffee maker in the room is for a single cup use.  I can understand how frustrating that could be if there were four of you in the room, but for future, we have our coffee station in the lobby that is available 24 hours.   Our standard rooms, unfortunately does not have refrigerators, only our suites have refrigerators.  You can request for one, and as long as we have it available, we will be more than happy to bring one up to the room.   As far as the pool area, it will be addressed accordingly.   Thank you again, and please feel free to contact me directly if there is anything else you would like to discuss.

Summary: Nice facility and friendly staff. Fitness room equipment could use an upgrade but I would stay again. The location is easy to find and very close to Seal Beach. The Subway shop across the parking lot is a plus for a quick meal/snack.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We will be upgrading our equipment in the future, but in the meantime, I am happy to hear to enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary: The room was very comfortable. I always look for some place with free internet, complimentary breakfast, and especially waffles! Breakfast had just about everything one could want. The room had plenty of electrical outlets for everyone's electronics and the beds are great. The only thing that would make the room better is a microwave and fridge. Linens and towels great, huge pool towels. Staff was very friendly. AC/heat very responsive. Kids liked the full-mirror on the closet door. Not on a highway - a rarity for LA, so no traffic noise.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  I am so happy you enjoyed your stay with us, and we look forward to having you all back.

Summary: Nice place to stay--clean comfortable. Easy access. This is all that I wanted to say. So I will keep typing so that I get the 200 min character requirement. So I will keep typing so that I get the 200 min character requirement. So I will keep typing so that I get the 200 min character requirement. So I will keep typing so that I get the 200 min character requirement.

Very clean, nice hotel. Free internet access. Close drive to the beach. The hotel staff was very friendly and the check in process was super quick. I didn't get a chance to enjoy the breakfast but it looks like there was quite the selection. I will definitely stay there the next time I'm in the area.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The free breakfast had a variety of food. The room was quiet and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and I slept very well. The staff was very friendly. The only negative is the hotel is a little out of the way.

Quiet area. Convenient to beach cities. Everything is within 5-10 minutes. You can spend a day at nearby beaches or Long Beach. Lots to see.  Reasonably priced for California.  We like staying at Hampton Inns because for the most part they are the same everywhere.  Good service!

Like all Hamptons, the room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  Initially, there was no refrigerator in the room, but we mentioned something, and the staff brought up a mini refrigerator.  The breakfast was OK, my kids liked the waffles, but the egg dishes were just so-so.  The fruit, muffins and bagels were good.

Easy access to freeway except for construction on Seal Beach Blvd.  Love free breakfast and parking.  Pretty good asian fast food across the parking lot. So close to beach and the amazing shops of Seal Beach.  Sofa bed for our teen pretty uncomf, our bed great.  Walls seemed thin, could hear conversations, water running, toilets etc and a lot of pounding from one room the first night. We were on a side next to a road so traffic noise was a bit of an issue but not terrible.  Very clean rooms and hotel and great staff.  Able to print our plane tickets out in biz area quickly.  Front desk got us extra blanket and pillow and bandaids we needed. :)

we got in around 4 a.m. and they still held the room for us, when we arrived in our room, the beds felt like clouds and snuggled right to sleep, the rooms were spotless, the breakfast was superb,it was so nice to meet up with family for coffee in the lobby. and the hot tub/pool was refreshing after a day on the beach. I will definitely stay here the next time I come to visit, thanks Hampton for being a home away from Home

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with Great Weekend Rates
Summary: My family and I stayed three nights at the Hampton Inn & Suites Seal Beach on a recent vacation to California. The hotel was conveniently located within minutes of Seal Beach Main Street and pier, as well as Long Beach, so there were plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. There is also a Starbucks, a Subway and a Del Taco (which our room overlooked) right next to the hotel (this thrilled my teenage son). The Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach was just 15 minutes away as well.  Our room with two queen beds was spacious and clean, as was the bathroom. There was no ventilation in the bathroom though, so it tended to get steamy after a shower. Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, the air conditioner is often off when you return to your room, but it does cool the room

Summary Heading: Extra charges, so-so breakfast and no fan!! Run the other way!
Summary: We stayed here for the 4th of July weekend and were totally shocked to find out that the hotel puts a hold on your credit card of $20/per day for “incidentals”. This is on top of the authorization they have received on your card for the room. Nowhere on the hotel website or any other booking site does it inform you of this ahead of time. It seems like a small amount, but we were staying for 5 days, and the additional $100.00 caused my card to be declined! ARE THEY KIDDING??? I have stayed in WAY BETTER hotels than this and they don’t place a hold for daily incidentals. Makes me wonder what kind of clientele they are attracting to their hotel that this is a necessary policy.   Also, the “complimentary breakfast” left a lot to be desired. Most mornings they ran out of basics like

Summary Heading: If you need internet - don't stay here
Summary: While the hotel was comfortable, trying to do business with a wireless connection was impossible. Even the business center system was so slow, that it often timed out. Quite frustrating.  The breakfast was typical, loads of sugar and high carbohydrate foods, very little healthy. The parking was often full but could be found.   The room was spacious and the noise level tolerable.

Highly recommend.  I stay here on business and when we visit my mother, which is frequently.  I have never been dissatisfied with any part of my experience there.  Rooms are always clean, in excellent condition, and the staff have always treated me with courtesy and respect.  Service is excellent.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Seal Beach
Summary: Just stayed for two nights last weekend and we really enjoyed our stay.  It's close enough to the beach and downtown area - only a 5 minute drive, yet less expensive than staying right on the beach.  Front desk staff were friendly and helpful, gave us all of the extra towels we needed.  Room was large enough for three of us to fit comfortably.  Pool was small but nice.  Located next to a Del Taco, Starbucks, Subway and other dining options.  My only minor issues were no refrigerator in the room, and even though it was billed as two queen beds, they felt small.  Our hotel a  couple of nights later also had two queen beds and they were obviously larger than these.  These really looked and felt like double beds, which is OK but don't advertise as two queens if they really aren't.

We enjoyed our stay, even tho the maids use way too much deodorizers in the room after asking for none.  Room was clean, bed comfy, desk staff was helpful and nice.  Good location and great beaches and close to all attractions.

Weekend family trip.   Good location. Easy access. Excellent Stay.  GREAT Beds! Some of the best we have ever had!   Super clean.  Great complimentary breakfast. Excellent front desk staff!  Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but powdered eggs... really??
Summary: Loved the hotel, only negative was the morning breakfast.  Is it really necessary to offer powdered eggs on the buffet? If you can't offer real eggs, don't bother!  Everything else very good, clean, very friendly staff, very enjoyable stay.  Just stay away from the "eggs."

Hampton Inn & Suites is our primary hotel when traveling.  We find everything about Hampton Inn is perfect for our taste.  Rooms are comfortable, provide things needed to rest and get ready for any event or occasion.  Complimentary Breakfast is just right ...  We recommend Hampton Inn to ALL our friends and family.

Summary Heading: This is an extremely noisy hotel
Summary: Located east of Seal Beach on a busy street and with a Del Taco right next to it, the local noise makes it impossible to sleep with the window open.  The air conditioner sounds like a jet engine when it comes on.  It only comes on after the room is so hot that I awoke in a sweat.  Then it roars until the room is too cold.  If the Del Taco doesn't wake you the air conditioner will.

We had an enjoyable stay at this Hampton Inn and recommend this hotel. The breakfast had a variety of different hot and cold meals with each day a new choice of hot foods was presented.  It was wonderful and a great way to start the day. The room was clean and comfortable. The whirlpool was fantastic.  The business center had up-to-date computers and peripherals. I could print from my computer in the room to the business center. The exercise fitness room was clean, good combination of exercise equipment, and plenty of room to work out. After our long drive, and checking into the room, the whirlpool was a welcomed site.  It was very relaxing. A great stay.

The hotel is conviently located to restaurants and beaches. I was so happy to find coffee, creamer in the lobby at night.  This is a nice touch. I was very pleased with the hotel cleanliness and staff's hospitality!  Thank you for a wonderful stay!

i chose this hotel because the area is nice and safe enough to go for an early morning run...i found the desk staff only minimally polite and not overly helpful...plus the a/c thermostat did not work right so i was alternately too cold or too hot and could not seem to get it adjusted

Unfortunately, at 4:45am  it sounded like a dump truck demo outside of my room.  The noise lasted about an hour.  The location was ideal for my nearby business, but not a great value when you can get any sleep.

Let me say that the staff is amazing.  Cinthia was the epitome of customer service.  I've never stayed here before, but will definitely come back.  You need a car to explore Seal Beach pier and Main street.  We stayed in a suite, plenty of room for the two of us. Yes there is some traffic noise being that the hotel is between 2 boulevards, which cannot be helped. Bed & pillows were so comfortable.  We had a microwave, coffeemaker and fridge in the room. Free wifi too.  Pool & Jacuzzi were relaxing after a day exploring.  We used the fitness room too.  Walked to Starbucks for some snacks, there is a subway within walking distance as well.  Seal Beach is much quieter than other beaches in orange county & los angeles county. I would definitely come back to this hotel.  Alot has to

Very friendly staff and clean hotel.  The bed was the best ever had in a hotel.  Large bathroom but only small shelf in extra large shower for a bar of soap.  All toiletries ended up on floor of shower.  Stained chairs but the rest of the room was clean.

Summary Heading: A nice place near the beach
Summary: Hampton Inn is a lovely place to stay.  The building is well attended to and the complimentary breakfast is first class.  It is also in an excellent location not far form the ocean and center of the cute beach town called "Seal Beach."  This Hampton Inn even has a Starbucks across the street.  It really isn't needed, though because the coffee served in the breakfast room is really delicious!

Wonderful stay! Clean, beautiful hotel! Friendly, helpful staff!   We know the area so easy enough to find a restaurant but only fast food adjacent to the hotel and no sit-down restaurant visibly close by.  Seal Beach is a beautiful area and it is just a short drive to the ocean, shopping, and restaurants.  This location is not directly off the freeway, but access is easily down the street.

We Always stay at this hotel when we come visit the Seal Beach Area, Breakfast is basic but hey its free so who can complain!! We have been in King Suite and 2 Queen room, Both where great super roomy and they where able to get a roll a way in each room which was great so kids didnt have to share bed.. Cant wait to go back!!

Very nice hotel in Seal Beach.  Stayed there to visit Boeing, which was next door.  Maybe the reason the room was $179 for the night. Also, the reason the wireless Internet was fast.  The next time I'm going to prefer a room facing the front of the hotel, sure to be quieter. The overnight front desk person was there when I walked down at 3AM to get a bottle of water.

My experience wold have been more comfortable if I had been told how to operate their A/C system on a hot day to best serve my needs and not return to a hot room since it is a motion detector system and will not cool if not in the room. The staff did not think to tell me this when I brought this to their attention.

This was our last stop at the end of our week long vacation.  the hotel is conviently located and about 15 minutes from Long Beach Airport. It's very clean and welcoming.  The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Free breakfast was fresh and plentiful.  We plan on coming back and I would definitly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we're in the area.

Disclaimer: I like Hampton Inns. They are consistently good and this one was no exception. You are greeted by friendly and helpful desk clerks (I especially liked that when she was checking us in, answering questions and printing out maps for directions, that she immediately called someone from the back, when another couple came and needed to be checked in). The room was large with a sofa and table, a stuffed sitting chair, adequate lighting,  desk and chair and night stand and lights on both sides of the king bed. There was a microwave, small refrigerator and a coffee maker. The sink was separate from the toilet and bath. There were plenty of toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, small bars of soap) and twice the needed towels and wash cloths. The hot water took forever

This hotel is in a quiet location.  There were mostly business travelers, so less kids and vacationers.  I enjoyed a nice 2 mile walk to the beach every day.  This hotel is fairly close to the freeway, but not too close.  The breakfast was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  I will stay here again.

Except for the fact there was no refrigerator in the room, everything was extremely nice.  A very modern, up-to-date hotel with many amenities.  Rooms were clean and beds very comfortable.  The employees were very courteous and helpful, especially one desk clerk who went out of her way to give us directions.

Picked this hotel cause we were in town for the Long Beach Grand Prix.  It was only 10 miles away. Took us about 15 minutes to get there.  All hotels were booked up in Long Beach and very expensive. There are alot of restaurants in the area to choose from, also gas stations.

Summary Heading: Best Hampton Inn I've ever stayed at!
Summary: The hotel was clean, fresh and comfortable.  The staff was exceptional and always made a point of greeting us anytime we came or left the hotel.  As a frequent traveler for business, this was undoubtedly the best Hampton Inn that I've ever stayed at and will only stay here on any future trips to the LA area.

I stay here regularly for work and find it to be a cost-effective and very nice hotel.  It's close to Main Street in Seal Beach and has great breakfasts.  There's a Starbucks next door and it's close to the 405, which makes trips outside of Seal Beach easy--including trips to the airport.  I'm a regular visitor and the staff makes the experience easy.  The gym is nice, too.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  Great to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to continually be your prefered hotel here in Seal Beach!

Summary: Came here a year ago with family. Was very impressed at the time. Decided to return this year for a weekend getaway. This stay was exactly the same as the last one...it was terrific. Extremely clean rooms, lobby, and breakfast area, friendly and professional staff, free parking right outside hotel, nice breakfast selections, and so quiet. We stayed for three nights and my husband and I were amazed at how quiet our room/floor was. Easy access to long beach, and we loved how you could walk outside and access food and coffee (Subway, Starbucks, and a small Japanese fast-food place)...very convenient. Felt like a home away from home:) Would not hesitate to return again and again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review, and for coming back and staying with us again.  We hope we can continue to serve you and your family and we would be more than happy to have you come back again and again!!!

Summary Heading: Very happy - clean rooms, friendly staff, great management, lots of stores/restaurants nearby
Summary: My family and I loved your hotel and staff and will stay at your property every time we need a place at Seal Beach.  My daughter and her family actually stayed at the Hampton Garden Grove a few days during our trip to be closer to Disneyland.  Although they were satisfied with the property/service at Garden Grove, when they checked back in to the Seal Beach property, they expressed that they did prefer the Seal Beach in comparison.  Front Office Manager, Front Desk, Housekeeping, and Maintenance were always welcoming, helpful, and friendly.  The rooms, business office, fitness center, and breakfast lounge were always in pristine order.  I was not familiar with the Seal Beach area and thought that there might be a restaurant or two nearby.  We were thrilled that there were so
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We look forward to seeing returned guests, and there is no better compliment than earning returned guests business!  Thank you!!!

Summary: The hotel was clean and affordable.  Check in is not till 3P on the dot, so don't bother showing up early.  If you do however they have a very comfortable lobby with a TV nice couches and seats.  I chose to stay here because it was close to my grandparents who live in Leisure World and is only 2 miles from downtown Seal Beach.  The bed was comfortable and room was very clean. You get about 40 channels on the TV in room and the Free HBO is a plus in my book.  The Ayres is a little nicer (newer), but I've had to many bad experiences there to ever go back.  If I need to stay in a hotel in this area again I will not hesitate to stop here.  Lastly it is close to the 405, 605, 22 freeways, but beware Los Alamitos/Seal Beach Blvd. is under construction and you should avoid entering the

Summary Heading: Central location for exploring Southern California
Summary: This is a great location to explore Southern California. We discovered the hotel because there was a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center and hotels near Disneyland were booked up. The Hampton Inn is within 20 minutes of Disneyland and is near the 405 freeway. Long Beach and the Queen Mary are within 15 minutes and the South Coast Plaza shopping center is within 15 minutes of the hotel. This assumes the freeways are not in grid lock as there are in the morning and afternoons.   The hotel is clean, quiet, and serves a complimentary breakfast. It is part of the Hilton chain of hotels. Parking is free and there is not a resort fee, unlike most of the hotels neat Disneyland.  The beach is within 10 minutes of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Another great experience at a Hampton Inn. Loved this Seal Beach Hotel.
Summary: My boyfriend and I checked into the hampton inn & suites seal beach for 2 nights. It was the beginning part of our trip before traveling up to big bear mountain for 4 nights.   We absolutely loved this hotel.  The staff, especially Jessi at the front desk was so helpful and nice he really made our late night check in pleasant when we first arrived.   Jessi was very helpful because the first room my boyfriend and I were put in, the AC was not working, Jessi came up to our room in 2 seconds to fix the issue, once he saw there was nothing he could do he apologized then he switched our room in a matter of minutes and we really appreciated that.   The beds at the hampton inn are always comfortable, soft bedding, clean and comfy pillows.  The room is always clean, fridge, microwave,

This is a decent hotel for a reasonable price. The rooms are basic but spacious and clean. The pillows could be firmer and I had some trouble getting the temperature just right, but that was not such a problem in February. The hotel is conveniently located, with a Starbucks and some restaurants next door and 5 minutes driving to the I405 and the PCH. Breakfast was so-so, but at this rate I could not expect much better.

We stayed here for a visit to Disneyland.  About a 15 minute drive to Disneyland. Great breakfast, clean rooms and hotel.  The staff were very helpful.  Check in process was smooth and fast.  Rooms were large and well cared for.  Would definitely stay here again.

Best service, very clean rooms and and very friendly staff! When down to Long Beach to watch my daughter compete in a dance competition and stay the The Hamptons in Seal Beach two nights. We've stayed here before and really liked the accommodations.

Summary Heading: Nice, Quiet Hotel with Excellent Customer Service
Summary: We went for a quick getaway to Seal Beach and enjoyed staying here. The breakfast was good with lots of variety. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. We had a problem getting a movie in our room, so the hotel switched us to another room and they were very understanding. This hotel is not in walking distance of the quaint town of Seal Beach, you have to drive there. Still it is an excellent value.
Manager Response: Thank you choosing Hampton Seal Beach for your quick getaway.  I'm happy to hear you had a great experience with us and even more so, for sharing that with your review.  We look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary Heading: Beat out the Double Tree Hotel Maya
Summary: We were booked to stay at the Hotel Maya down by the harbor for three nights, but after one noisy night there, needed to leave and find a better place-fast! I had stayed at this great Hampton Inn a few years ago and was impressed with the quiet and comfort. Well, I'm happy to say that nothing had changed.   Still the same clean, pretty, polite, comfortable (I'm thinking of buying one of their beds), and quiet place it was before.   This move really helped our trip as you can't really enjoy anything with bad sleep, right?   Right. Great place, and we'll be back when we return to the area. Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  It is great to know you enjoyed your stay, and that you are a returned guests.  We look forward to more future stays with us, and we hope we continue to wow you guys.

Summary Heading: Very Good Value and Very Clean
Summary: We stayed here for a few days between Christmas and New Year. This is a very clean Hampton Inn located by a little strip mall in what appeared to be an industrial area in Seal Beach. It was right next to a Boeing campus and what appeared t0 be a military secured area. The breakfast is wonderful and offered a variety of items. The first day we were there, we had the traditional scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes choice. The next day they had a breakfast burrito bar. On both days they had a waffle stations and an assortment of pastries of muffins, bagels, toast, etc..  The rooms were nicely appointed. However, we did not have microwave and refrigerator.  We used this hotel as a base to do some sight seeing in the Long Beach and Redondo Beach area. There was a Denny's just
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to post your thoughtful review.  I will make sure to address your concern about the Front Desk, and thank you for bringing it to our attention.  We hope to see back soon!

Summary: This newer Hampton Inn has a nice layout, well appointed rooms for this star level, and is a very good value with a hot breakfast (waffles, oatmeal, full continental assortment, and a rotating hot item) and Internet access included.    The property is in very good condition inside and out.  Rooms have a decent sized flat screen TV with a full featured remote.  The standard rooms have a full bath (sink, toilet, and shower/bath combo) and a full length mirrored closet.  The location is fine ... just a couple miles from downtown Seal Beach ... in a pretty vacant strip mall, although a thriving Starbucks is across the parking lot.  Long Beach and Huntington Beach are just a few minutes away via PCH.  One misstep by the desk clear occurred when we arrived late in the evening to check
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  I'm very happy to know you had a good stay with us.  Also, for bringing up the parking lot concern.  I will definitely address it with the team.  We look forward to your visit with us.

Summary: A little hard to find as the address and the GPS didn't seem to match up quite right, but found it none the less.  Friendly staff, nice clean decent room as usual, and a good (free) breakfast in a location that would work well for business or pleasure.  Price was right as well, it's a good choice when in the Long Beach/Seal Beach area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review.  I'm really happy you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you for staying with us, and I hope to see you and your family back soon!

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn Seal Beach Awesome Location
Summary: Great hotel, awesome location. This Hotel is close to the beach, and main street Seal Beach where you have your choice of great bars and restaurants. My wife and I had a great get-away weekend from the kids! and home...
Manager Response: Stephen,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on our hotel.  Nothing pleases me more than to see such great reviews from our guests.  Hope to see you both back, and we'll be more than happy to be accomodate your great get-away weekend anytime!

Summary: We were traveling for a family reunion and needed a hotel that was family friendly. The hot breakfast was well-stocked and had a great variety of items. There is a Starbucks, Del Taco and Subway in the parking lot so we had other options as well. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Francis was especially helpful when the exit was closed and my GPS froze while on the detour to the hotel. He stayed on the phone with me late at night until we reached the hotel. Also, kudos to the housekeeping staff. I had unknowingly lost a piece of jewelry and the staff placed it on the desk while cleaning our room. I can't thank them enough for being honest! Overall, a great stay.Centrally located. We will definitely stay here again when we return to the Huntington Beach area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for such a wonderful review.  I'm glad that we were able to provide you and your family accomodations to your liking and friendly and helpful customer service.  I can't wait to share your review with the team.  Thank you again, and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Stayed twice (first and last night) during visit to southern CA... Overall very nice... nice staff... nice room... good breakfast... adequate free parking... Accommodated request for small frig to keep medication cool... Would most definitely stay here again...
Manager Response: Thank you for the opportunity to provide your accommodation while in southern CA.  I am happy to see your overall stay was to your liking.  Looking forward to your future stay with us!

Summary Heading: A little noisy, but otherwise perfect
Summary: The noise was due to the proximity of two busy streets to the hotel.   I admit I'm sensitive to noise, so I always travel with my earplugs, so it wasn't too bad.  Rooms towards the center of the hotel in the even numbers are the quietest, I suspect.  Now for the hotel itself.  ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL in every way.  Friendly staff, beautiful clean rooms, marvelous breakfasts, plenty of parking, well-kept grounds, I could go on and on.  I don' t know how anyone could be disappointed with this hotel.  As for location, a short drive down Seal Beach Blvd and straight through the light at Coast Highway and you're in quaint Seal Beach.  Many restaurants, shops, the Seal Beach pier and a beautiful clean sandy beach.  Free on-street parking while visiting the beach (unlike Huntington).
Manager Response: WOW! Thank you for your kind words!  I'm glad you had a wonderful stay with us, and sharing that experience here on TripAdvisor!  Thank you and we look forward to your next stay!

Summary: Stayed here while working in Huntington Beach. Have been a loyal HHonors member for many years so I usually know what to expect. All my expectations were met here. Great service, clean, well appointed room, good breakfast and good value. It's southern CA so you can expect to pay more than the heartland.  Francis at the front desk was awesome ... goes out of his way to serve and provide any assistance needed. The entire staff said "Welcome back" each time we returned.  A nice home away from home for 4 nights.  Great service provided by all.
Manager Response: We love being the home away from home for our travelers, and I thank you for giving us the opportunity to be your home away from home!  I appreciate your awesome review, and sharing it on this site!  Thank you, and we will see you soon!

Summary Heading: Awesome Stay- Francis at front Desk & housekeeper Maria wonderful....
Summary: Really nice Hampton Inn, easy check in and free parking and wonderful breakfast...In fact we just booked 3 more days....Keep up the great service.....We stayed on the 4th floor room 421 very clean and fresh...Big bathroom very clean and we were close to the elevators and ice machine just like I like it...Very comfy beds and they were clean....
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review.  I am thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you back again!

Summary: This Hampton in Seal Beach is more like a Hilton Hotel (Of course Hilton owns them).  The staff are very accommodating.  The rooms are very clean and the hotel is brand new.  I loved the breakfast buffet--THE best oatmeal you have ever tasted!  Only down side is that the room rate is also similar to a Hilton!  But for the area they are in, there is no easy comparable accommodation....if you can get a reservation!
Manager Response: Thank you! It’s good to know we were able to provide you the service and accommodations to your liking.  I hope we can be your preferred hotel here in Seal Beach, and we are looking forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary Heading: Typical Hampton Inn in quiet Seal Beach location
Summary: The hotel is in a fairly quiet location near the Seal Beach Naval Weapons Station and Boeing. There are no beach views from this hotel---one side of the hotel overlooks Del Taco on busy Westminster Boulevard and the other side of the hotel overlooks a strip mall parking lot. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean but the decor needs to be updated.  The entire hotel has this ugly green carpet and the rooms are painted in bland colors.  The rooms with double queen beds don't have small refrigerators in them--it would be nice if all of the rooms had refrigerators instead of just the suites. The breakfast selection was good.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Happy to hear the team provided you with friendly and helpful service.  We will definitely look into having all of our rooms equipped with refrigerators in the future, but for the time being, we do have some refrigerators available upon request.  We hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Thank goodness for marquesa and Sandra
Summary: The 2 staff members went above and beyond duties by helping me mend my bridesmaid dress which I seared a hole in it trying to steam iron it - they were fantastic and have never had service quite like this before.  Thank you
Manager Response: Wow, we are so happy to have been able to help.  We definitely would love to hear the rest of the wedding story! Thank you for staying with us, and hope to see you back again!

Summary Heading: A traditional place with excellent service.
Summary: I travel a lot because I'm in the navy, and a colleague of mine recommended me to stay at this property with him. To my surprise, the property was "great!" The service was phenomenal, nice clean rooms, and was just a joy to stay there. It almost felt as if I was on vacation even though I stayed there on work orders. I will definitely continue to stay at this property as well as the Hilton family hotels. Thanks for the hospitality!
This hotel is very clean and in a fairly quiet spot. I enjoyed being fairly close to so many restaraunnts. Huge police presence in this town which I find comforting. I will be back for sure!

First off, none of the rooms are real suites even though the website says "2 rooms". There is just a sitting area at one end. Second, pool hours are loosely enforced. We had a room by the pool and had to call the desk every night after 10 and ask them to clear out the pool area so we could go to sleep. Third, there is a ton of traffic noise if you are on the side of Seal Beach Blvd. Breakfast is ok. This place was ok but for the price I would stay elsewhere. Location was good though with lots to eat nearby.

I stayed at this place 6/15/2012 and checked out on the 19th. I was staying in room 414. I believe I was bitten by BED BUGS!! It happened the first night there. I didn't know it at the time. Later that next day I just had some itchy spots, but as the days went on, the worse it got.I attached a couple pictures on this site so people can see what these bugs can do if you're sensitive to them. The bits do hurt a lot if touched now, but in the beginning, they felt more like mosquito bites.
Manager Response: We take bed bugs complaints very seriously, and look into it so that we may address it accordingly.  You spoke to Front Office Manager and he personally checked your room along with Housekeeping Manager and found no bed bugs, who later informed you of this.  This is a very busy hotel, and we have since rented out the same room you stayed in and no signs of bed bugs, or any other complaints of bed bugs.   If you are not aware, bed bugs problems doesn’t just go away.  It needs to be professionally treated, a very meticulous, and time consuming process.  It is certainly not something I, as a manager can ignore and not take actions.  I am not sure where and what bit you, but I can guarantee you that it is not bed bugs in the room you stayed in at my hotel.  As a manager, I welcome my guests’ reviews and comments and use these as a tool to continually better the hotel and our service.  We look into everything that is brought to our attention, and address it accordingly.   I believe in good business practice, and you posting libelous, unfounded accusations about the hotel is reckless.

Summary Heading: Quick stay, nice area...if you have a car....
Summary: Nice location, not far from Pacific Coast Hwy.  But, you need to drive from the hotel for most better restaurants.  And...be aware...your are about 1/2 mile from the Seal Beach Police dept station...no drinkies here!!!!  I never saw so many police cars during a Thursday evening drive.  They are looking....for anything.  Be advised.  Nice breakfast at the Hotel.  Nice staff.  Comfortable room with an upgrade to a suite at the front desk.  Once again, being a Hilton Platinum has nice advantages.  I will be back to stay here again!!!
The hotel is quite and very reasonable for the Long Beach area! Cookies on arrival, breakfast included and a great little Japanese restaurant across the parking lot.

Summary Heading: Quiet location, great staff, super clean = great value
Summary: I can't find anything bad to say about this property. We visited for a family reunion and we were pleased with the entire stay.  The property is about 1.5 miles from Main Street Seal Beach, and it's easy to get anywhere in the LA or Orange Counties from this hotel. The bed was very comfy, excellent bathroom with walk in shower, clean carpets, and a very clean and quiet property throughout.  Good food choices nearby and a Starbucks is right next door.  The only reason I can't rate it higher rating is that the location is industrial, next to Boeing and other aerospace buildings.  Despite this, it was very quiet!  Very enjoyable stay.

Summary Heading: Good location in Long Beach area
Summary: Stayed for the Long Beach Gran Prix weekend April 13-15. Not much in the way of restaurants within walking except Japanese Restaurant & a Subway. Both right in front. But lot of bars & food place with in a mile or so.   No shuttle van.  Must request a fridge, but they got one at no charge.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, great staff.
Summary: This was an excellent property, easy to find and very close to many different things we wanted to see. As I've come to expect from the Hampton Inn, it was extremely clean, with a very friendly staff and coffee and cookies waiting in the evening, plus a great breakfast with fresh fruit the next day. I would have given this all five stars, but the pool was freezing!

. This nice hotel is only three mins from the Pacific Coast Hwy. If you go south  on PCH you are in Huntington Beach in 10 mins. If you go north you are ten mins from Seal beach and about 30 mins from Long beach. It is a very central location and easy to get anywhere. The hotel had complimentary breakfast and very clean rooms with a nice little pool and hot tub. The computer was free and the room cleaning staff friendly. The front desk people were a little less than helpful but a minor problem. This hotel is run by the Hilton chain of hotels so it  has a good reputation. The price was reasonable and I used some leftover points from another visit. So I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to find quick ways to the beaches of Southern California.

Summary Heading: Unfortunately, I stayed only for 1 night.
Summary: Don't you hate it when you find a great hotel and scheduled to stay only 1 night?  The service from the staff was excellent and for the most part, my room was fine.  The rates here can get expensive and you have to shop around for a decent rate.  The location is near restaurants and coffee shops.  You won't be trapped staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Quality stay at this Hampton Inn
Summary: Stayed for four nights at this Hampton Inn at Seal Beach. Pretty typical for Hampton. Easy parking, clean rooms, comfortable beds. Front staff are welcoming and efficient. The hotel itself is nicely priced and I felt safe and secure in the room. The rooms were quiet and appropriately equiped. There is a small area off the front desk where one can purchase forgotton items. The pool is outside but for CA who really cares (unless it's raining like while I was there!). Would have liked to use the hot tub but it is outside as well.  The breakfasts in the morning were on time (even early) and were always well done. Scrambled eggs and such. Nice selection of fruit and cereals too.   One morning another traveler with me mistakenly took my briefcase with her and I feared it had been

Summary Heading: Wow...really good value and excellent place
Summary: My wife and I are frequent travelers to the area--she has to come here every other weekend for graduate school.  We used to stay at the best budget motel you can find for under $100 around Long Beach: the Super 8 motel near the roundabout.  With discount codes, I used to be able to get the place for around $70.  Lately, the prices have gone up with the economy and our price tags now average $78 there.  Anyways, this weekend I noticed that the super 8 was completely booked.  So, I looked around and found this place and noticed all the great reviews.  For $113, I thought it was worth a try.  Wow, my wife and I are super impressed.  For just $40-50 more, it's like going from the ghetto to Beverly Hills.  I'm exaggerating a bit, of course, and I think the Super 8 motel is a great

The staff was helpful and professional at all times. The overall condition of the hotel is very good and for the price its a bargain. We had a nice room on the 4th floor that was comfortable and quiet. The included breakfast worked out fine, no eggs but bacon, muffins, cereal, waffles, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, juice, etc...It was good but not great and I didn't have to spend extra money to get it. Located not too far from the beaches, the 405, or downtown Long Beach, all with in 5-12 minutes by car. Have stayed here in the past and will again in the future.

Easy to find, at the corner of Westminster Ave. and Seal Beach Blvd., with dining and shopping options close at hand. The staff seems friendly, and the room was clean.  Our particular room had a walk-in shower rather than a tub; fine with us. Don't know that this would be a choice for a longer vacation, to say, Disneyland (although the park is not that far from here), but for a day or two it is just fine.

This hotel is about six miles from my house but my wife was having some long lost friends stay the night and I wasn't ready to hear them reminisce about high school. Besides there were some very important college football games being broadcast!  I was trying to keep the cost under $100.00. I had hopes armed with a AAA card and a AARP card that as a last minute walk-in, I might get a more favorable rate. Particularly when I cited another Hampton in nearby Cypress as being cheaper, and a Courtyard by Marriott, also in Cypress, being even cheaper than that. Alas it was not to be. I received the advertised rate which with bed tax came out to about $130.00.  I requested the highest floor hoping to avoid any noise. Granted by being on the fourth floor there was no one above me, but

Our soccer team stayed at this hotel May 2011.  It was a nice hotel, clean and roomy.  Two queen beds and a sofa, very comfortable.  Served a nice breakfast which saved us money in eating out.  We will definitely stay again.  Parking was a bit of a problem due to the fact it was so busy that weekend for the soccer tournament, but that's to be expected in a situation like that.

Expectionaly helpful staff.  Helped me with directions and sugestions for resturants. I had to call them several times because my GPS wasn't working.  First room they gave me had a wall or overhang in front of the window. I went back to the front desk and got it changed. The air conditioner kept malfunctioning. Luckly it wasn't  too hot. They did come up and try to fix it. I have read that other people also had trouble with units at this hotel.  You could hear every door close up and down the hall.  Nice spacious room,comfortable bed. Location was convient. couple of resturanmts right across from the hotel. Close to the beach and pier. Liked Seal beach by the pier. It was windy that day but restrooms were clean, and close and you could walk up to the pier and to the streets of

This is the third time we have stayed at the Seal Beach Hampton Inn. It is amazingly quiet. The rooms are large and the bed comfortable. They have a great spread for the free breakfast. It is just minutes away from the beach.

I like staying at the Hampton inn, but the one in seal beach is really one of a kind. Right away the decor sets a really pleasant vibe. Everyone was so helpful, and I was especially pleased with the breakfast.

Although this hotel is in Seal Beach, we prefer to stay here when visiting Long Beach. It is located off the 405 freeway and close to the PCH. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The internet and parking are free. The room was very spacious for having two queen beds. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful.

We (mother, daughter and 16 year old twin grandaughters) stayed for four nights to attend our soccer tournament and hang out at the beach.  We did not want to stay in Long Beach as the area can be unpredictable so picked I Seal Beach.  We have always had great luck with Hampton Inns but this was by far the BEST EXPERIENCE yet.  The staff at the desk were very accomodating, gave suggestions and directions.  We were given a roll away, refer and micro after we arrived.  Staff allowed my daughter to use the washer/dryer to wash the team's soccer uniforms for the next day.  The breakfast food was excellent and different each day.  Each evening there were fresh backed cookies at the front desk.  The room was very spacious and clean.  Great place to stay!.
This hotel serves its purpose as an effective airport hotel for the Long Beach Airport.  I would not stay there as a destination, but the hotel is an excellent value for a brief travel stay.

Summary Heading: Adjacent to Boeing and close to beach
Summary: This hotel is adjacent to Boeing - a simple matter of walking across the parking lot. There are several fast food eateries in the same lot.  i.e. Subway, Starbucks, Del Taco, Dominos Pizza, etc. Plenty of free on-site parking. Beach access is 1.8 miles west on Seal Beach Blvd.  Hotel has buffet style breakfast with  a selection of cold and hot foods.
