Numerous restaurants and shops are located close-by on corner of Westminster Blvd. and Pacific Coast Hwy.  Hotel has outdoor swimming pool.   Staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: excellent hotel for short or long stay
Summary: I went  to visit my three daughters who live in a triangle from this hotel for the holidays, so... this hotel was the best location.  Never having stayed at a Hampton Inn I was not sure what to expect.  The hotel accommodations were excellent.  Wonderful staff, extremely helpful, very clean, and wonderfully prepared breakfasts(complimentary).  Choices of cereal, fruit, juice, pasteries, eggs, bacon, sausage, and make your own waffles. The room was large and very clean.  I stayed for ten nights and will most definitely return. Oh, the hotel is near the highway(405) so all the malls were close.  And very near to long beach, where one daughter lives, which has a very artsy feel with great restaurants.

Summary Heading: "Be sure to ask for a room with a dry floor when you book."
Summary: We stayed here for a few nights a couple weeks ago.  We came down to visit my mom at Leisure World, and it is very conveniently located.  We usually stay at the Ayres, which is also conveniently located, but they were booked up, and we had been wanting to try this place since it opened.   When we first walked into the room, it was like a sauna, and I immediately adjusted the wall thermostat.  We went out to eat, and when we came back, it was still very warm. I called the desk and they said they would send someone up to fix it. We went out to see my mom, and when we came back, the room was not hot, not warm, not even cool. It was cold. The thermostat read 60 degrees.    It had apparently been running cold for a number of hours, and the floor below it was saturated with

This was our first time staying at this hotel and were we pleased! First, the room was very spacious for having to queen beds. The size of the bathroom was very adequate, but do not expect a mini fridge or microwave. The bedding was very good as well, and the room also had a flat screen tv. The place was very clean. The parking, although not plentiful, was somewhat wrapped around the hotel. Greeted exceptionally well by the desk staff. Continental breakfast area was spacious for a hotel of this size and comfortable. Scrambled eggs, sliced sausage, muffins, fruit slices, juices, coffee, and a waffle maker were some of the breafast items. We will be back!

Expedia gives it 2 1/2 stars, but consider:  • Quality of the bedding was up there with a four-star Hyatt (perhaps just a notch below). • Do you like getting your shampoo, mouthwash, etc. in those fancy little clear bottles seen in four-star hotels?  The Hampton Inn won't disappoint. • Late-model 32" HDTVs. • Spacious rooms, especially the bathroom, which was cavernous! • The most friendly and helpful staff i've ever encountered. • Free parking and internet. • The free breakfast goes beyond the typical "continental" breakfast of juice and a cold danish by providing a rotation of hot items. Perhaps you'll see pre-made omelets one morning, and biscuits and gravy the next. • Great location.  Minutes from the beach and the Naval Weapons Station.  If you have business at Boeing, it's

Summary Heading: Nice Quiet Hotel - Great for Pre-Cruise Stay
Summary: We had an extended family and booked two rooms at the Hampton Inn for a Sunday night.  It was a one night stay before boarding a 4 day Baja cruise.    Overall the hotel was excellent.  It was new and quiet!  The breakfast was your typical cont. breakfast.  We were about 10 minutes from the cruise terminal.    Overall we would stay here again.

We had stayed here last month over night and liked it so much we returned for a weekend. As with our last stay the staff, rooms (the beds are so comfy) and breakfast were outstanding. The big difference for us this trip was how quiet the hotel was even with 40 or 50 teenage girls (a rowing team) right on our floor. We never heard a peep!

Summary Heading: A Quiet Hotel by the coast.
Summary: This hotel is perfect for the weekend traveler.  The hotel is right next to a Boeing building and a naval base, but the facilities are brand new, located a couple of miles next to the coast, Seal Beach, the air is clean and the place is serene, very peaceful.  If you have a car then you'll have no problem getting to and from this hotel.  Its a great place if you don't like crowds, which obviously we don't, especially kids running back and forth in the hallways.
I usually like the Hampton chain, but this one is new and and in a really nice location. We were attending a wedding in Long Beach and needed a place to spend the night, this worked out perfectly.

Stayed here for 3 nights over Thanksgiving.  Check in was effortless, Misty at the front desk was so nice and accomodating.  We were even able to change our room immediately without hassle.  (Nothing wrong with the room, it was our choice to move)  Hampton is part of the Hilton Hotel collection, although just a small step down from an actual Hilton Hotel proper.  Everything was neat, clean, and new, as I beleive this hotel was just finished sometime in 2009 or late 2008.  They have the well known hot breakfast, which is different everyday, you definatley won't go hungry, they do a nice job.  The beds are very comfortable (Hilton has the sweet dreams beds in all thier hotels I think) so needless to say, a good nights sleep, as the pillows were great too.  One reviewer had

This is a nice new Hampton with pleasant staff, clean rooms, and good rates. We were upgraded to a suite as Gold Hilton Honors members. The room was large, well appointed with a wet bar, king bed, sleeper sofa, computer work station and seporate dressing area. We will stay here again if in the area.

Fairly new hotel located near Boeing and the Naval Weapons Station.  Attractive decor, very clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was very quiet, nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable.  Breakfast was fairly standard for a Hampton Inn, with hot eggs and sausage patties in addition to a variety of breakfast items.  Located on Seal Beach Blvd (fairly busy street) but no issue with noise. Convienent to Seal Beach and other nearby cities, and close to the 405 freeway.

My husband and I stayed two nights while attending my daughter's graduation at CSULB. Very friendly and helpful staff. My husband has back problems and found the king bed to be wonderful. At checkout, I had accidentally left clothes behind and housekeeping turned them in to lost-and-found. Hotel staff called me and even offered to ship the items to me. Starbuck's, Subway, and a great nail salon are just a walk across the hotel's parking lot. When in town, we will stay there again.

Beds comfortable, great pillows. Had a real problem with the in room heater-was too noisy to run, so sweltered all night-couldn't wait to get home to get some sleep. Too bad they went cheap, since it's a new hotel in Orange County-not a cheap destination.  If they can fix that I would definitely recommend it (ok, they could do better with breakfast, since Ayers (a nearby hotel) has a GREAT buffet breakfast.

Summary Heading: Just What I Was Looking For
Summary: I stay at this property at least once every couple months and thought I would finally share a review.  Everything is very clean as the hotel is only about 8 months old (I think).  My favorite part of the rooms are flat screen HD televisions in every room.  For someone who is just looking for a comfortable place to sleep and to watch the game on TV that night, it's ideal.  Also has the same amenities that other Hampton's have: free internet, free breakfast, and the Hampton bed.  The beds are great - extremely comfortable.  The breakfast is ok.  As for the hot stuff, somedays are better than others, but I usually just grab a muffin / bagel / coffee / banana and head out.  Service is awesome.  Their staff has been improving since my first stay and the group they have is excellent.

Summary Heading: Not a vacation resort, but a comfortable stay
Summary: While visiting family in Seal Beach, we decided to try out the new Hampton Inn & Suites since it is located just a mile from family.  This hotel is directly adjacent to the Los Alamitos Reserve Station and the Boeing Company, so best to have a car since it is not an "in town" type of place.  The hotel is brand new and very clean. It is very geared to the business traveler, though we found it comfortable for our vacation stay as well. We had a room with a small kitchen area with a microwave and small frig, which we like so we can feel more at home on a longer stay. The kitchen area has it's own counter, sink and cupboards,which was nice and uncrowded.  The hotel also has a continental-type breakfast every morning from 6-10 am that includes a hot egg or french toast  dish each

I stayed here over Mother's Day weekend after planning a quick trip home to surprise my mother.  I didn't feel like spending $500 a night for the Huntington Beach Hyatt and the Huntington Beach Hilton was sold out, this was the next best choice for me based on location and cost.  The hotel is brand new so everything is clean.  However, we had a bed side lamp that didn't work and there was no way to turn the bathroom fan off, it ran all day/night.  Also, there were some teenagers staying in the room across the hall from mine and they were smoking in their room (I both saw and smelled this). Although the Hampton Seal Beach was a little hard to locate due to a lack of road signage, it was well worth the effort to find.  The property is beautiful and the room was perfect.  I stayed in a King room.  It had a flat screen plasma television.(Cool!)  Only a couple of miles from the Seal Beach Pier, a beach visit was easy.
